name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Bolton Flayed Men
description:
House Bolton has the most-armored unit on the field of battle. The Flayed Men cavalry are clad in heavy plate armor and their horses are equally armored in thick barding. Only the toughest and largest horses can withstand the great weight put upon them by all that steel. While they might not be the fastest cavalry unit, they are certainly the hardiest. And their own war flails make enemy defenses seem pointless as the spiked balls wrap around limbs or curve over shields.

The Bolton Flayed Men Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game allows Commanders to field a rough and rugged cavalry unit in their forces. As a Neutral unit, The Flayed Men will work for any army willing to pay their price. They have some of the best Defense Saves in the game, letting them stay on the field, utilizing their nasty war flails on the enemy for quite some time.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Conclave Editora, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Monty Python Fluxx: Black Knight Expansion
description:
"None shall pass!"

Thanks to the Black Knight Expansion, the Black Knight will finally start making an appearance in your games of Monty Python Fluxx! This Creeper is so in-your-face that NOBODY can win if he's in play...unless, of course, one of the six new Goals in the set requires him. He's joined by another oft-missed character: Tim the Enchanter! Tim causes things to explode! The ten-card pack even includes a couple of New Rules including "It's A Quest"!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Singing

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Suicide Squad Expansion
description:
In this new expansion, players will control members of Task Force X aka the Suicide Squad, as they navigate an exciting 3 mission Adventure Mode mini-campaign.

When a dirty job needs doing—one that requires unsavory methods and ethics that stretch the definition of legal—the government unshackles the Suicide Squad. Scruples shall not stay the hands of these former ex-cons, not if the ends justify the means.

An eternal threat of time travel and meta humans challenge the Squadron members during this campaign. But how they handle this threat it is up to you! Upon completing each mission, players may flash the included QR codes to uncover additional information regarding the ulterior motives lurking behind the antagonists of this campaign.

Because it’s somewhat uncomfortable and disingenuous to call Squad members “heroes”, in this expansion they will be identified as “Anti-Heroes”– a replacement term for heroes.


10 new miniatures and 13 hero screens, including Season 1 characters such as Harley Quinn and Killer Croc.
11 tiles
15 equipment cards.


All Suicide Squad characters are Versus mode compatible and have individual powers.

You can expand your anti-hero mission pool further by adding the following core box components. This component mash-up maximizes the thematic campaign experience.

Katana, mini, hero screen and the katana equipment card.
Killer Croc mini.
Harley Quinn mini.
1 service gun equipment card, allocated to Rick Flag
1 service gun equipment card, allocated to Amanda Waller
Poison Ivy mini. *
2 Carnivorous Plant minis and their tile *
1 Fire Axe equipment card allocated to The Joker's Daughter (Duela Dent)
4 Guard minis to use in with the Belle-Reve's Guards tile included in this expansion.


* If you own Poison Ivy (new 52) and the Carnivorous Plants Rex, you can substitute them for the corebox Poison Ivy and Carnivorous Plants.

Build your own Suicide Squad: select from a 14-character pool (13 in this expansion, plus Katana) and prepare to get your hands dirty.

At the beginning of each mission, when choosing heroes, you can decide to rebuild a new team or continue with the one you assembled for the previous mission.

Your choices are made from three types of anti-heroes: Leaders, members of Squad S and those of Squad X.

Each anti-hero enters play fully loaded with a preset selection of equipment cards.

Last, but not least, the Belle-Reve Guards tile adds to the game wide available henchmen/elite pool from Versus mode or Adventure mode if a hero has the command skill.

These upgraded veterans are capable of performing complex actions but cannot share a mission with “Guards” tile – so make your choice between the two carefully before each mission. Their hindering skill is a painful thorn in your opponents’ side when they are after your leader or lieutenant.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Tabbybrook Mage
description:
Tabbybrook Mages harness water in all its forms, using it to wash away their wounds, and drive their enemies back. When pressed they can even unleash frozen blasts of ice or scalding streams that burn the flesh with all the intensity of fire.

Contents

Tabbybrook Mage Assembled Model
Tabbybrook Mage Hero Card
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures

name: Skulk Hollow: Ancient Relics Mini-Expansion
description:
On the battlefields of Skulk Hollow, ancient relics can still be found amongst the various ruins that scatter the land. It's been said that crystalline bones of the wizards who sacrificed themselves during the creation of the Smallfolk still hold great power, even after being dormant for centuries.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management
publishers: Pencil First Games, LLC, Thunderworks Games

name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Executioners Chariot Boss Expansion
description:
Gather your courage, for this unholy executioner will stop at nothing to prolong the torment of the undead souls in his charge. Even if the executioner should fall, you still must face the malevolent steed that pulls the dark chariot—a horrendous beast from a forgotten age of barbarity. Do you have the determination to dismantle the wicked chariot and dispatch the hellish horse?

Contents:
6x Enemy Miniatures
2x Executioner's Chariot Miniatures
1x Mega Boss Game Board
All the cards, health dials and rules you'll need to play.

The Executioner’s Chariot expansion is also the first to include encounter cards of levels 1 all the way through to level 4. These encounters allow players to face the expansion’s new enemies before they even reach the boss tile. Are you up to the challenge?

This expansion includes components in English, French, German, Italian, and Spanish.
categories: Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Skytear: Outsiders
description:
This is a neutral-expansion box for the Skytear MOBA boardgame. The expansion contains:

4 Outsider Miniatures (38mm)
4 Outsider Cards (63x88mm)
48 Power Cards (63x88mm)
The additional Outsiders will add even more replayability to your matches.
The 48 Power Cards improve your deck-building options to further personalize the heroes in your Skytear collection.

Each outsider in this expansion was a hero, now consumed by the power of Skytear.
Gulbjarn, Terror of the Endless Night, stalks the wilds, crippling his foes with fear.
Haburat, Dark Vigilante, deals a deadly series of strikes, never ceasing his pursuit.
Cotlic, Lord of The Ancestors, will stop at nothing to conquer the lane for his glory.
Akimo, infamous Scourge of Puido possesses a hero, driving them to violence at the cost of their own life.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Caverns of Chaos: Tables and Missions for Four Against Darkness
description:
Chaos is ready to invade the world. Are you up to the challenge?

Caverns of Chaos is the first of a series of themed dungeon supplements. Using the core rules in Four Against Darkness and Four Against the Abyss, you may use this 26 page supplement to generate new missions, meet new monsters, and collect new treasure. The booklet includes six missions, new vermin, minion, boss, weird monsters, treasure and unique event tables, three new dungeon secrets, six new spells.

This is not a stand-alone product. You need a copy of Four Against Darkness (and for some of the content, Four Against the Abyss) to use this book.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Battles of the Warrior Queen
description:
It is AD60, and Governor of Britannia C. Suetonius Paulinus stands ready to deal his final blow against a vicious insurgency in Rome’s new province. Inspired by Rome’s implacable opponents, the Druids, the remaining fanatical warriors of a two-year insurgency hold out on the island of Anglesey. Having made an amphibious landing on the island’s shores, Paulinus and his legionaries must cut their way through fierce opposition on the beach.

While his cohorts ravage the island, a messenger reaches Paulinus with news of a tribe that is rampaging the eastern fringes of his province. The Iceni, led by Queen Boudicca, are reported to have murdered local Roman officials and their guards. Other reports soon arrive that the Iceni’s revolt is gathering both force and momentum as local tribes are responding to Boudicca’s call for open revolt. A large warrior force is said to be devastating Roman villas and farmsteads as it heads south towards the first Roman colony in Britannia, Camulodunum.

Paulinus realizes that with all four of his legions posted in the north and west, this new menace has the potential to ravage Roman colonies and cut his lines of communication. He faces the very real prospect of being Governor of Britannia in name only.

Battles of the Warrior Queen covers the major engagements during the rebellion of the Iceni tribe and Boudicca’s allies against the legions of Emperor Nero. Led by Queen Boudicca, the rebellion would be the greatest British threat to nearly four centuries of Roman domination of Britain.

Battle of Mona Insulis

Separated from mainland Britain by the treacherous waters of the Menai Straits, Paulinus faced the challenge of making an opposed beach landing on the Welsh island of Mona Insulis (today’s Anglesey). The Britons, arrayed along the shore in a dense and heavily armed line of battle, awaited the assault. Helping whip them into a battle frenzy were the Druid priests, for whom the island was their last sanctuary.

Battle of Camulodunum

On learning that the Iceni tribe had risen in revolt and were heading towards the Roman colony of Camulodunum (modern-day Colchester), the IXth Legion (named as “Hispana”) set off from its base in Lindum (modern-day Lincoln), under the command of legate Petillius Cerialis. Cerialis was a mercurial individual who had escaped the brink of military disaster before. His luck would be tried once again in his encounter with the Britons.

Battle of Bannaventa

After arriving on the mainland, Paulinus rode east and south in great haste. Outside Londinium news of the defeat of Cerialis and his IXth Legion reached him. Ordering evacuation of the city, Paulinus withdrew hurriedly northwards to the midlands and urgently concentrated the XIVth Gemina and the XXth Legions.

As Boudicca’s horde approached, Paulinus drew up his troops in close order in a defile, protected on his flanks and in his rear by dense forest. He new that the Queen of the Iceni would struggle to keep her disparate coalition in check for long, and would soon be compelled to attack. Whichever way it went, this would likely be the final, climatic battle of Boudicca’s rebellion against Rome.

To play this module you will need the maps, counters and rules that come with this module and the rules and some counters from Caesar: Conquest of Gaul. Battles of the Warrior Queen can also be played with the Simple Great Battles of History (SGBoH) rules.

Components:

One 32” and 24” back printed map sheet (one full and two half size game maps)
140 counters


(from the GMT Website)
categories: Ancient, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: Warhammer: Invasion – City of Winter
description:
Game description from the publisher:

No one is safe from the schemes the Dark Elves hatch in their City of Winter. With three copies each of 20 unique cards, half of which support the Dark Elves and their evil schemes, City of Winter is an invaluable Battle Pack for players looking to harness the Dark Elves and their fury.

Additionally, all the factions gain exciting new tactics cards that can return to the deck after they are played. The fifth Battle Pack in "The Capital Cycle" for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, City of Winter presents dramatic new deck-building options for the Dark Elves and other factions with 60 new cards (three copies each of 20 different cards).

name: Würfelland: Europe
description:
Würfelland: Europe is an expansion for Würfelland that consists of four new double-sided erasable game boards, with each side depicting a hexified version of a European country.

Gameplay is the same in Würfelland — and you'll need the dice from that game in order to play — except that to win you now need to cross off only five of the six treasures (instead of nine of twelve as in the original game), along with all the spaces of one of the six colors.

mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Era of Tribes: Modular Board
description:
Make your Era of Tribes a real 4X game with thousands of millions of possibilities to arrange 36 hexagonal unique and well designed tiles.

Build your own maps and scenarios and upload the pictures on BGG to share them with the community.

—description from the designer

name: Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 9
description:
Misha Koskiken is the poster child for sensationalism gone wrong in the best of times, but today things spiraled out of control. Her opponents snuck into an event and threatened her, so she incited her loyal devotees to violence. Now you have to interject between these two groups before things spiral further out of control.

In this thrilling new expansion for Hostage Negotiator, the Abductor isn't getting her own hands dirty, she has a flock of loyal fans to do it for her. You'll have to manage her petty tendencies and keep her paranoia in check before she ends up igniting this powder keg.

—description from the publisher

This Abductor pack is a 15 card expansion compatible with both Hostage Negotiator and Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave.

The English version of this promo was included as part of the first Promo Pack.

description:
Catapult Feud: Dice Ammo Expansion is a mini-expansion containing custom semi-soft D6 dice, where you get a 2nd shot if it lands with the Doubleshot face up. But beware if it lands with the Backfire face up, then your opponent gets to send it back at you!

name: Illuminati: Mutual Assured Distraction
description:
From the publisher's website:
It's getting easier to find the conspiracies all around us. Just look at the news.

Illuminati: Mutual Assured Distraction is about today's headlines. Supermajority, Health Reform, Bank Collapse, Superpatriot Act, Economic Stimulus – they're tools for world control. You knew it all along, didn't you?

This set introduces "New World Order" cards to the classic Illuminati game. A NWO card affects all the players, not just the one who put it down. This mechanic first appeared in the collectible card version of Illuminati. You liked it then – so here it is for the original game.

Illuminati: Mutual Assured Distraction contains 18 NWO cards to boost, penalize, and offend major political and social groups of all kinds. There are also five special cards to trigger, add, or remove NWO effects.

description: This is a new map for playing with two players. It also optimizes the actions spaces for two players.

name: WO Bonus Pack #2: ASL Scenario Pack for Winter Offensive 2011
description:
Following 2010's Winter Offensive Bonus Pack, this pack is similar, 3 new scenarios and a new map. Like the 2010 pack %60 of the proceeds from the sale are donated to charity. This years charity is the 'Richard Winters Leadership Project'.

Contents:
Geomorphic Mapboard 63
Scenarios

WO3 Counterattack At Carentan - 3 June 1944 Carentan, France
WO4 I Don't Like Retreating - 20 September 1944 Nuenen, Netherlands
WO5 Astride Hell's Highway - 25 September 1944 Koevering, Holland
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – Handuriel
description:
Only the rarest of individuals can walk the Path of Nature and assume the mantle of ranger. The elf Handuriel is one of them. Foregoing the comforts of his noble birth to protect the wild from the Darkness, his bow and knives are invaluable aids to any band of heroes!

Age of Darkness is a fully-cooperative strategy board game of tactical combat and dungeon-crawl style adventure for one to five players. Explore the world of Drunagor through the game’s immersive 3d environment and illustrated Points of Interest—where your choices determine the route your story will take! You need a copy of the Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness core game to play with this expansion.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Deluxe Advanced Squad Leader
description:
Deluxe Advanced Squad Leader contains eight full-color, geomorphic 11" x 26" mapboards depicting both urban and countryside terrain, eight sheets of overlays to modify the terrain, and 38 scenarios designed for play on the boards.

Deluxe ASL is simply ASL without stacking. It features an enlarged 2.2" hex scale, making ASL more playable than ever. There is sufficient room in each hex to place over a dozen counters without stacking, making the game both easier and faster to play. Informational counters can often be laid alongside units to avoid obscuring them, and the need for some informational counters (like Covered Arc markers) is eliminated based on unit placement within a hex. Some players even use miniatures on these boards to increase their enjoyment.

Deluxe ASL includes all the boards and all the scenarios from the long out-of-print STREETS OF FIRE and HEDGEROW HELL. The eight original boards (a-h) have been repainted by Charlie Kibler and finished in the "tri-fold" style of Deluxe maps i-l from Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #9 (with which they are completely compatible). The original 18 Deluxe ASL scenarios are included, all updated and rebalanced as needed. Charlie has also repainted the original Deluxe ASL overlays (from the 1995 ANNUAL), four additional sheets of wooden and stone rubble overlays, and two sheets of new terrain overlays to provide maximum flexibility for future scenario designers. Twenty additional, out-of-print Deluxe ASL scenarios are also included, updated, and rebalanced as needed.

These features make this package attractive to all ASL players, whether they have been Deluxe fans for 30 years or never before got the chance to play on the bigger hexes.

—description from the back of the box
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Commander's Edition
description:
Command Your Destiny!

In the BattleTech universe there remains one constant: the drums of war. And where there is war, valiant military commanders from the Greta Houses, the Clans, and other interstellar nations lead the charge of hulking BattleMechs, brave infantry, and daring aerofighters to certain victory or crushing defeat on the sprawling battlefields of distance worlds. Rally your troops onward into the fray, and surge forth to triumph over the enemy.

AlphaStrike: Commander's Edition collect into one handy volume the revised fast-play rules from the original Alpha Strike and the expanded rules from Alpha Strike Companion. Take command of large-scale engagements with tabletop-miniatures gameplay designed for the modern wargamer. Use the force-creation rules to marshal your armies, charge them into battle, and either reap the rewards of conquest or taste the bitter pill of defeat. The future of the Inner Sphere is in your hands!

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Star Fleet Battles Volume II
description:
Star Fleet Battle Volume II replaces expansions 1, 2 & 3. This boxed set includes revised rules and the standard ship display sheet included with the game are the original design not the later Commander SSDs. It includes 3 solitaire missions, 6 campaigns, and 21 other scenarios.

Four races are included with this expansion: The Hydrans, Andromedans, Lyrans and Wyn Star Cluster. Also included are the Commanders Rulebook Volume II, 324 die-cut playing pieces and the 32 page SSD booklet containing 150 starship designs.

The weapons introduced in this boxed set are the same as expansions 1, 2, & 3. Including the F type plasma, Tractor-Repulsor Beams, Gating Phasers, Fusion Beams and others.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Conan: Baal-pteor
description:
This man was naked except for a loin cloth and high-strapped sandals. He was brown-skinned, with close-cropped black hair and restless black eyes that set off a broad, arrogant face. In girth and breadth he was enormous, with huge limbs on which the great muscles swelled and rippled at each slightest movement. His hands were the largest Conan had ever seen. The assurance of gigantic physical strength colored his every action and inflection.

— Robert E. Howard, Shadows In Zamboula

Contains:

3 Tiles
1 Plastic miniature

KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

description:
A set of 7 new cards to mix in with those from the original game.

Expands

Mesopotamia
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Zombicide Survivor: Adriana
description:
Adriana had worked all her life just to get a chance. Blessed with potential but very little else, she worked days as a shop girl and nights rehearsing or performing with the chorus and dreaming of fame. Then, the zombies came out of nowhere on a busy Saturday and her dreams shattered in a few hours.

Adriana isn't alone, however. After a fierce zombicide in the mall with a team of survivors, Adriana decided to stop fighting just for herself and start fighting for the future. An enthusiastic volunteer, Adriana is now one of the fiercest zombie hunters in town. Her drive to save as many zombie survivors as possible and rebuild the city is a beautiful vision she shares with everyone.

Adriana is an optional promotional survivor available to those that raise an extra amount on their pledge for the Zombicide Season Two Kickstarter campaign. A zombie version (Zombivor) will also be included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Cool Mini Or Not, Guillotine Games

name: ASL: Journal – Issue Twelve
description:
ASL JOURNAL 12 is a 40-page magazine and expansion for Advanced Squad Leader and features nine articles, the latest Q&A/errata, and 12 new scenarios printed on cardstock. Also included is a corrected scenario card for scenario 181 Gavin Take from the recent YANKS, which was missing its red text and is being replaced here.

JOURNAL 12 includes the following articles:


The Umpire's view - Executive editors comment on this issue and coming games.
A Dose of Antifreeze - Peter Struijf helps guide you through the decision matrix of how to defeat enemy vehicles using bypass "freeze".
ASL Crossfire: AP119 Konev Cross John Slotwinski and Phil Palmer discuss their playing of this Action Pack 12 scenario.
Advanced Nuggets - Paul Sidhu brings light to some obscure and easily-overlooked rules.
"Ghost Killers" - Andy Hershey recounts the history of the Korean Marine Corps, featured in the upcoming Korean War ASL module FORGOTTEN WAR which Andy helped design.
Out With The Old... - Chas Argent looks at how old counter art from the Avalon Hill days is being updated for new MMP edition core modules.
MOSSMOUSE! - Paul Sidhu is back and explains how the "Principles of War" as taught by the United States Army can be applied to your ASL play.
Single-Hex Fire Groupology - Ken Dunn & J.R. Tracy de-mystify the Defensive First/Final Fire options available to units stacked together in the same Location.
Debriefing This issue's errata updates.
Scenario Analysis: AP71 Head In The Noose - Matt Shostak brings his magic analytical eye to this Action Pack 7 scenario.
Recon: Flames in Hatten - Chas Argent previews Andrew Rogers's upcoming HASL on this German-vs-American HASL set during Operation NORDWIND in January 1945.


JOURNAL 12 also includes

12 new ASL scenarios:
J182 Belgian Blitzkrieg (German vs Belgian, 27 May 1940)
J183 A Real Barn Burner (French vs German, 31 May 1940)
J184 Dayan To Meet You (Australian vs Vichy, 8 June 1941)
J185 The Haunted Castle (German vs Russian, 22 June 1941)
J186 Castles On The Horizon (German vs British, 20 November 1941)
J187 In Deadly Combat (Russian vs German, 30 December 1941)
J188 Grab And Go (Russian vs German, 20 August 1943)
J189 Buckley's Block (Japanese vs U.S.M.C., 13 January 1944)
J190 Trial Run (Canadian vs German, 17 January 1944)
J191 Rebels Without A Pause (Slovak vs German, 5 September 1944)
J192 Taking Some Flak (Finn vs German, 28 October 1944)
J193 Raff's Rules (American vs German, 24 March 1945)

1 YANKS replacement scenario card (180-181)


2/8/17 JOURNAL 12 corrections:

• J192 Taking Some Flak: In the VC, last sentence, between "count" and "for" add "double".

• On page 31 of JOURNAL 12, the last sentence in the box of the "Single-Hex Firegroupology" article indicates that Final Fire in the DFPh might be available after having used Subsequent First Fire in the MPh. But that is not the case, since using SFF would mark a unit with a Final Fire counter, which precludes firing in the DFPh. We regret this error, which was introduced by the Editors in the editing process.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – The War of Five Kings
description:
The War of Five Kings is the first monthly installment of fixed cards for the "A Clash of Arms" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, based on George R.R. Martin's bestselling Song of Ice and Fire saga. This Chapter Pack contains twenty different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame. (The first edition of this Chapter Pack included only one of each character card, while the second edition includes three copies of each card.)

The five kings have summoned their mighty hosts, and their queens are protected by guardian knights. The realm is past the time for treaties; the hope for peace is lost. Now is the time for the champions of Westeros to prove their worth on the field of battle. Now is the time for war.

"A Clash of Arms" cycle:

- The War of the Five Kings
- Ancient Enemies
- Sacred Bonds
- Epic Battles
- Battle of Ruby Ford
- Calling the Banners
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Galápagos Jogos, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Stratagem Publications LTD

name: GIPF Project Set 3
description:
This includes three expansions for GIPF.

Contents:


6 YINSH-potentials for each player
6 PÜNCT-potentials for each player
3 extra basic pieces for each player


See the project GIPF wiki page for more details on the potentials' powers.

The YINSH-potential can slide off its piece, any number of empty spots, for sneaky deployment. The PÜNCT-potential can land atop certain other pieces (different ones than the DVONN-potential), changing their color, or possibly introducing more GIPF-pieces mid-game!

GIPF Set 3 contains 6 white and 6 black YINSH-potentials, 6 white and 6 black PÜNCT-potentials, and 3 white and 3 black extra basic pieces to play "Ultimate GIPF". For the very brave amongst players: that is GIPF with 21 basic pieces and all 5 different kinds of potentials.

This is probably the last part of Project GIPF - after all those years players can combine all games :)

First product of cooperation of Kris Burm with company SMART.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building
publishers: Don & Co., Smart Toys and Games, Inc.

name: Coup: Inquisitor Promo
description:
This is the promotional character for the Coup (Resistance universe) - the Inquisitor

The Inquisitor replaces the Ambassador, and it gives the player two options:

You can either draw one card for swapping purposes (a bit like the Ambassador), or you can attack someone. Assuming the attack goes through (they can still call your bluff) the inquisitor player can look at one of their cards and either let them keep it or force them to discard it and get a new card. Both Ambassador and Inquisitor block the Captain.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Political
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: DreadBall Ultimate
description:
DreadBall Ultimate is an expansion for DreadBall: The Futuristic Sports Game. This boxed expansion includes a Season 3 rulebook (available separately); Four Giant MVPs; a durable non-slip rubber gaming mat to represent the game field; a DreadBall Ultimate card deck; and a DreadBall Ultimate counter sheet.

DreadBall Ultimate allows up to 6 players to face off on an expanded game pitch. DreadBall is hectic enough facing just one opponent. Face the mayhem of competing against up to 5 other players!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Abominape vs Crocosaur
description:
This set adds these two massive abominations to your game.

The Abominape is so large that it treats Survivors as its (very tasty) playthings. If it hasn’t done so already, the Abominape snatches up a Survivor in its zone, disabling them until it has been eliminated by a Dynamite.

The Crocosaur is a hardy monstrosity. When it is hit with a Dynamite or Damage 3 weapon, roll a die. On a 4+, it survives the attack! The only way to guarantee its defeat is to spend 2 Dynamite cards instead of 1 when throwing a Dynamite at it.

The Abominape vs Crocosaur Pack contains:


1 Abominape figure
1 Crocosaur Figure
2 Abomination Cards
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Sequoia: Expansion Pack
description:
Sequoia: Expansion Pack adds a 6th player, partnership variant, and the Negative Value expansion to this dice based area majority style game.

The Negative Value expansion modifies the area scoring for some regions to negative values. In these cases, those with the least influence in the region lose points as opposed to those with the most in the region earning points.

Additionally, this expansion increases the maximum player count to 6 which can be applied to the base game, partnership variant, or the Negative Value expansion.

The partnership variant pairs players into teams such that their combined influence is measured for area majority and both partners in the most successful team are the winners.

This was packaged together along with two other expansion in 10-Minute Games: Expansions and currently not available by itself.
categories: Dice, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Deutscher Spielepreis 2016 Goodie Box
description:
The Deutscher Spielepreis 2016 Goodie Box is a product to support the Deutscher Spielepreis, the second biggest German board game prize, for which thousands of players vote each year between May and July for their favorite game. This box contains a small expansion for four of the top ten games of the Deutscher Spielepreis 2016: Mombasa, Codenames, Isle of Skye, and T.I.M.E Stories.

Promos include:

T.I.M.E Stories: Special Reward - contains three beacon tokens, which can be used in the third run of a mission.
Codenames: Authors & Games - Additional cards for the game, on one side game designers, the other games titles.
Mombasa: Cooked Books - Includes 6 book tiles and 1 bookkeeper tile, adding extra point score for the end of the game.
Isle of Skye: Adjacency Scrolls (Nachbarschafts Schriftrollen) - Six tiles added to the mix, containing scrolls that score features on adjacent tiles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

description:
Description from the publisher:

In the dark places of the world, the shadows hold more than just secrets! Cursed by plagues, dark dealing demons, and black omens of supernatural terrors yet to come, the forsaken lands around Brimstone are not to be traveled lightly.

This 15-card Mine Encounter Supplement for Shadows of Brimstone is themed for terrifying Plagues, black rituals, supernatural omens, and deals with dastardly demons that may be hard to refuse.

CONTENTS

Card #94 Sign of the Dark Omen ×2
Card #95 Pestilence Flies ×2
Card #96 River of Blood

Epic monster pack for Deep Madness.

- 1 Penitent monster miniature
- 1 Forsaken monster miniature
- 2 Monster Cards (in five languages)
- 2 Spawn Cards (in five languages)

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave – The Wurmspat
description:
The Sorcerer Fecula Flyblown saw a vision of a shard-curse of endless sterility in which nothing stayed dead long enough to rot, and was horrified. She summoned a monstrous wyrmaggot which swallowed the Sorcerer and her two favoured bodyguards whole. This creature burrowed until it burst into Beastgrave, where it disgorged the group in a tide of steaming vomit. Together, The Wurmspat resolved to cure the curse at the mountain’s heart by spreading the filth so beloved of their deity.

Three is the holy number of Nurgle, Chaos Lord of Decay, and three is the number of fighters in The Wurmspat. Fecula Flyblown, a powerful Sorcerer, is accompanied by two supernaturally tough Chaos Warriors. You’ll be able to assemble the three push fit models in drab green plastic quickly, ready for a game, and your three fighter cards reveal their stats to get you up to speed right away. 32 faction-specific cards allow you to harness the power of the warband's disgusting ploys and upgrades, plus objectives catering to their play-style. You'll also find 27 additional Universal upgrade, power, and objective cards to use with any warband!

This set contains:
- 3x push fit The Wurmspat miniatures – no glue required to assemble
- 3x fighter cards, representing each fighter in your games – Fecula Flyblown, Sepsimus the Plaguesworn, and Ghulgoch the Butcher
- A further 59 unique cards (only available in this set) to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave, including:
- 12 objectives for The Wurmspat
- 10 upgrades for The Wurmspat
- 10 ploys for The Wurmspat
- 9 Universal objectives
- 9 Universal upgrades
- 9 Universal ploys and spells
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Hostage Negotiator: Negotiator Cards – Series 2
description:
This promotional pack includes 10 Negotiator Cards and 1 special Abductor card to be used with the solitaire board game Hostage Negotiator.

Decide before the game begins if you would like to use a Negotiator card. You may select one of your choice or shuffle and take one at random.
Each Negotiator card has a special ability that can only be used ONCE during the game.
In general, using a Negotiator card will make the game slightly easier, but some in Series 2 will actually make it more difficult.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Aquatica: Raum the Cruel & Nerine the Law Keeper Promo Cards
description:
2 promo cards that introduce new King cards to Aquatica. Originally given away at SPIEL 19 and other conventions. Later available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

9 - Raum the Cruel: Conquer 1 location and raise it all up.

10 - Nerine the Law Keeper: Copy the effect of the upper card from any other player's discard.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Nautical
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Chaining, Hand Management, Open Drafting
publishers: Arcane Wonders, BoardM Factory, Cosmodrome Games

name: Ravine: The Spirits Expansion
description:
Prepare to face the judgement of the Spirits of Ravine. In this expansion, some players take on the role of the Spirits that haunt the island, allowing you to play with up to 9 people. Will they help you or torment you? Only the Spirits know as you fight to survive through the chaos of day and night.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Trading

name: Bolt Action: Armies of the United States
description: With this supplement for Bolt Action, players have all the information they need to field the military forces of the United States of America. Entering the war after the attack on Pearl Harbor, the United States immediately went to war on several fronts. In Europe and Africa, American troops battled against the Germans and Italians, while in the Pacific they faced the forces of Imperial Japan. This book allows players to choose from dozens of different troop types including Sherman tanks, Marine raiders, and paratroopers, and build a US force to fight in any theatre of the war.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight

name: Star Wars: Legion – AT-RT Unit Expansion
description:
"General Solo, is your strike team assembled?"
–General Madine, Star Wars: Return of the Jedi

The Rebel Alliance is constantly outgunned in their war against the Empire. Since they cannot hope to match the awe-inspiring military production of a galaxy-spanning Empire, the Rebellion has turned to salvage in order to supplement their forces — such as with the AT-RTs. First introduced by the Republic during the Clone War, the All Terrain Recon Transport, or AT-RT, has since been co-opted by the Rebel Alliance to aid their war against the Empire.

The Star Wars: Legion – AT-RT Unit Expansion includes a single new AT-RT miniature for you to add to your Rebel army, complete with three different gun attachments that can be attached to your miniature. Along with the AT-RT, you'll find the associated unit card and an assortment of upgrade cards for you to enhance your AT-RT and other units.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: The Card Game – New Alliances
description:
From the publisher:

“Well, short help is better than no help at all.”
–Han Solo, Star Wars: Return of the Jedi

Descend to the Sanctuary Moon of Endor in New Alliances, the second Force Pack in the Endor cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game! The Rebel heroes have reached the floor of the Sanctuary Moon, but they quickly discover that they are not alone. The native Ewoks are formidable warriors in their forest home, and they could be crucial allies in the fight to destroy the Empire.

In New Alliances, players gain six new objective sets (two copies each of four normal objective sets and one copy each of two “limit one per objective deck” sets). Like other packs in the Endor cycle, New Alliances introduces new mission cards – objectives played under your opponent’s control that offer powerful benefits when destroyed. With the return of neutral objective sets and three brand-new fate cards, New Alliances is sure to change your decks forever, whether you participate in the illicit spice trade, lock down the sector with the Imperial Navy, or join the Ewoks in the fight against the Empire!

Contains objective sets 190-195.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Sho-Riu, The Dragon King XXL Enemy
description: This pack comes with 1 miniature and all of the cards and rules needed to use Sho-Riu, The Dragon King as in your Shadows of Brimstone adventures. Also included are 2 new missions.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Mage Wars Academy: Druid Expansion
description:
In this expansion set, play as a verdant Druid whose skillfully tended plants and carefully crafted potions show that the natural way is the best! Game play is quick and exciting, with tough tactical decisions and devious surprises every round!

Players can customize their spellbook with exciting spells from this and other Mage Wars products. Summon mighty plants and swarms of insects, brew potent potions, and release the strength of nature!

2 Mage Cards
70 Spell Cards
Game Markers
Rules and Codex
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Arkeis: The Jewel of the Cult
description:
Amidst the dunes shifts a mysterious silhouette. It’s hard to make out its details, as large veils hide its true form to the curious eyes who gaze upon it. But as it gets closer to your camp, you soon understand that this newcomer brings one more enigma with it, one more mystery that needs be solved… and this enigma is called ‘Meema’.

The Meema Expansion contains many elements, among which Meema herself occupies the central spot: she’s a fully playable character joining the four colorful characters already available! In order to fit into your games, she comes with her own miniature, player board and Experience cards.

But that’s not all! The expansion also contains a new scenario in which Meema will take the stage!

This exclusive episode takes place before the main campaign begins and will teach you more about her and her place in the grand story of Arkeis…

—description from the publisher

"joining the four colorful characters already available" was written before the fifth playable character (Professor Robert Pierce) was unlocked.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game

name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Ballparks Expansion
description:
The Ballparks Expansion adds 10 cards that provide a new game mechanic, Home Ballpark.

When playing with Ballparks, each player is dealt two random ballpark cards and selects one for their home ballpark. The other card is discarded face down. Whenever a player has the Home Field, the effect of their home ballpark applies. Ballpark effects apply to both players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That

name: Clinic: Deluxe Edition – 5th Extension
description:
Occasionally, I’ve heard it said that some players build their clinic nearly the same way every time, and that the construction part of the game lacks variety. So, in The Extension, I added Urban Design 1.0 to require different floor plans, and Underground Utility Work to reduce the available space and to resize and reconfigure your player boards however you want. Then, in the 3rd Extension, I added Urban Design 2.0.

But still… you have all become veterans of all of these obstacles, and now you need more!

So, I offer you new layouts for the ground floor, and a new series of double tiles, which should not only accelerate development of your clinic, but also allow you to play on these more difficult floors — plenty to get you out of your rut!

—From the introduction of the rulebook
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medical, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement
publishers: AVStudioGames, Capstone Games, Giant Roc, LudiCreations

name: Arkham Horror: The Dark Pharaoh (Herald)
description:
From Fantasy Flight's website :

"Know, O Thief, that these things are mine. For I am the Dark Pharaoh, him of the Crawling Chaos. Take what is mine and your blood will boil in your skin. As I reveal to you my Other Faces and my True Glory."

This is an official Herald, published by Fantasy Flight Games (originally only on the website, later also in Arkham Horror: The Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion (Revised Edition)), to be used when using the Herald / Guardian mechanic in games of "Arkham Horror".

Rules Summary :

When the Dark Pharaoh is the Herald, place the Dark Pharaoh monster token in the monster cup at the start of the game even if Nyarlathotep is not the Ancient One.

Know O'Thief : Each time an investigator gains a Unique item (including starting equipment) that investigator loses 1 sanity.

These Things are Mine : Each time an investigator gains an Exhibit item, roll a die. On a failure that investigator is Cursed.

Blood Will Boil : At the start of the Upkeep phase, before rolling for Curses, each Cursed investigator loses 1 stamina.

My Other Faces : All Mask monsters gain 1 toughness. In addition, each time a Mask monster is defeated, add one Doom token to the Ancient One's Doom track.

My True Glory : If Nyarlathotep is the Ancient One and he awakens, his combat modifier increases by 1 (to -5, -6, etc) and he has one extra doom token placed on his doom track (for a total of 12, 13, etc) for each Mask monster on the board.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Novel-based, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Naboo Royal N-1 Starfighter Expansion Pack
description:
Sleek and agile, the Naboo Royal N-1 is well-suited to its role as a diplomatic escort for that planet’s ambassadors. Beneath the gleaming chromium of its elegant spaceframe are advanced Nubian engines further customized by the Theed Palace Engineering Corps, making the N-1 one of the fastest starfighters of its time.

In addition to the beautifully detailed and pre-painted Naboo Royal N-1 Starfighter miniature, this expansion contains six ship cards, seven upgrade cards that give you greater control over its prodigious speed, and the tokens and maneuver dial you need to defend Naboo or any other planet.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Mondo: Zusatzspieler Pack B
description:
Mondo: Zusatzspieler Pack B is one of two expansion packs for Michael Schacht's Mondo released in late 2011. Each pack includes a double-sided game board that allows an additional player to be added to the game. The pack also includes new land tiles (identical in sets A and B), new scoring methods and new challenges to complete (both unique to pack B).

By combining packs A and B, up to six players can compete in Mondo – and theoretically the number of players is unlimited if you add an equally unlimited number of packs.

Integrates with:

Mondo: Zusatzspieler Pack A
categories: Animals, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Agricola Game Expansion: Purple
description: Agricola Game Expansion: Purple is both an upgrade kit for the revised edition of Agricola as well as an expansion. This item contains five pre-painted miniatures with colored accents that can replace one set of wooden player pieces from the base game. In addition, it contains twenty new cards for Agricola, including some that are exclusive to this expansion.
categories: Animals, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ortus Regni: Expansion
description: Expansions to Ortus Regni that add components for two additional players each. Each includes two additional full player card sets (green and gold Earls in the first, purple and orange Earls in the second) oak trays, painted cubes, and an extra Army card deck.
categories: Card Game, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Star Wars: The Card Game – So Be It
description:
Description from the publisher:

"You underestimate the power of the dark side. If you will not fight, then you will meet your destiny."
–Darth Vader, Star Wars: Return of the Jedi

Massive fleets meet in deadly interstellar battle above the Sanctuary Moon of Endor. A few noble heroes infiltrate the palace of Jabba the Hutt in a desperate attempt to rescue their captured friend. In the darkest places of the galaxy, evil things stir. In So Be It, you can relive some of the most iconic moments of Return of the Jedi.

Like other Force Packs in the Endor cycle, this Force Pack introduces new mission cards to shake up the conflict phase, new fate cards to increase the tension of every edge battle, and new neutral objective sets to expand your deckbuilding options. Here, you’ll find iconic characters like Admiral Ackbar and Lando Calrissian in disguise as Tamtel Skreej. Whether you’re helping the Empire complete the second Death Star or leading a Rebel assault on the shield generator, So Be It welcomes you into the most thrilling moments of Return of the Jedi.

This is not a stand-alone deck. A Star Wars: The Card Game Core Set is required to play.

Contains objective sets 201-206.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Asmodee, Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti

name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Item: Quibbler
description:
This card was handed out during Gen Con 2017.

This Item carries the following ability:

Gain 2 [INFLUENCE]. If you are sitting so you view the game board upside down, also draw a card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Alone: Deep Expansion
description:
Content:


3 hero miniatures
Character Cards
4 boss miniatures
Mission cards


The Alone - Deep Expansion includes 3 hero miniatures (with the corresponding character cards and 2 mission cards) and 4 boss creature miniatures (with the corresponding mission cards). The expansion also includes 5 special creature cards that can be used with the mob rules. They allow players to use miniatures of unique creatures in a different way. The special rules for rooms, on the other hand, give the hero player the opportunity to interact directly with the surroundings.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Hobby Japan, Horrible Guild

name: Sanctum: Singleplayer
description:
You may already be familiar with racing against other heroes with the goal to banish the evil that plagues Sanctum. With fighting your way through hordes of enemies while gearing up to face the blight that is Demon Lord, all to restore the realm to its former glory.
Now with Sanctum Singleplayer, you find yourself on the green meadows by the dock alone, the only one called to exterminate the evil in the city of Sanctum and the whole adjacent region. You alone must cleave your way through the demons and save the land. It is a lofty mission, but you are the only one who can do it.
Everything needed for the solo variant can already be found in the Sanctum box; all you need are rules for how to set up and what changes in the rules.

Go forth and become the hero you have been called to become!

You can find the rules in the "Files" section or directly in this .pdf link https://czechgames.com/files/rules/sanctum-solo-rules-en.pdf
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Vudù: Double Trouble
description:
New expansion of Vudù! Team game with all new curses affecting the couple.

Speaking about gameplay, Vudù: Double Trouble extends the number of player to a minimum of 4 and a maximum of 12.

In the box you will find 30 new cards (12 Double Curse, 6 Curses, 9 Artifact and 3 Permanent Curses).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Thor and Valkyrie
description:
Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Thor and Valkyrie allows you to add two new characters to the Marvel: Crisis Protocol miniatures game.

Thor, Prince of Asgard, son of Odin the All-Father, wields the mighty hammer Mjolnir, which grants him command over lightning and storms. As an Asgardian, Thor is blessed with superhuman stamina, durability, and speed and stands as one of the strongest beings in the Universe. A stalwart member of the Avengers, Thor never rests in his fight to prove himself worthy.

The fierce warrior Valkyrie is leader of the legendary Asgardian Valkyrior, Odin’s personal unit of shield-maidens. Her Asgardian physiology grants her superhuman strength, stamina, and durability, but it is her extensive martial training and her skill with a blade that places her among the greatest fighters in all of Asgard.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Railways of the World: The Card Game Expansion
description:
In Railways of the World: The Card Game, players use track cards and city cards to build a series of railroad routes and deliver goods. As the game progresses, players work to connect more cities, upgrade their engines and deliver goods through a network of routes.
The Railways of the World: The Card Game - Expansion adds new mechanisms and additional bonus scoring options for the base game with:

• Tunnels to connect existing cities, giving access to cubes and impacting city control.
• Switchers to allow track color to change during building thus allowing connection to a new color city.
• Grey Cities to provide additional goods for deliveries.
• Barons to provide additional bonus scoring options.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trains
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Mass Hysteria exclusives
description:
Exclusive to Kickstarter backers of the Deluxe Edition of the base game. The backer pledge level was called 'Mass Hysteria'.

Contains:


The Sandman ghost miniature and ghost card
The "impossible mode" super-sized (100mm) angry Stay Puft Marshmallow Man figure and ghost card
Four double-sided Sedgewick Hotel game board tiles
A 12" x 12" Giclee print of the games characters and logo
Glow in the dark versions of the 6 game dice
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: Murder Behind Closed Doors
description:
It is a cold winter day when Sherlock Holmes receives Inspector Gregory into his office in Baker Street. The inspector shudders a few seconds from the change in temperature, rubs his gloves, then finally takes off his coat and accepts an invitation to sit down.

"A frosty morning, eh, Gregory? I think it takes a rather unusual murder to force you to come see me with this cold."

"Your deduction is sadly apt, dear Holmes. They killed Dr. William Young this morning, at eight, as he opened the clinic where he worked."

So begins "Murder Behind Closed Door," a single extra case expansion originally written by a fan in Italian, and later published by Asterion Press as an Asterion Gaming Days 2015 event promo for Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective.

Available for download on the Asmodee Italia website.

Translated into English by BGG Forum members and freely available in the Files section.
categories: Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Nemo's War Expansion Kit
description:
The expansion kit for Nemo's War includes a dozen cards with more adventures from the Jules Verne novel and alternate endings to the game/story (including "Return to Mysterious Island," "Another Thousand Leagues" and "Bottom of the Sea").

In addition to new rules for using the Treasure Fleet and Cannon tokens included in the base game, six more deadly ship counters are included (armored frigates and battleships), plus rules for using them all and a "historical game" scenario.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Ugly Gryphon Inn: More Patrons
description:
You’ve finally cleared out the bar and sent everyone off to bed...but what’s that sound? A knock at the door, at this hour? Why, it’s just what you need: MORE patrons jostling for a spot at your inn! It’s gonna be a long night...

These patrons are particularly picky, and will make your night even more difficult!

These expansion cards are shuffled into the starting deck, adding to the available Patrons found in the base game. You’ll need to manage these new needy customers more carefully, as your inn will require one more contented patron to be considered successful.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pax Renaissance: 2nd Edition – Age of Reformation Promo Cards
description:
Suppose the Fourth Crusade’s Sack of Constantinople never happened, allowing the Second Rome of the Byzantines to suppress the sudden rise of the Ottoman Turks. They may find support from the Russians, with whom they share the Orthodox Religion, and maybe the Austrians and the French after the Catholic-Protestant split. After all, they had already survived the Fall of Rome, the Persians, the Arabs, the Bulgarians, the Seijuk Turks, the Rus, the Vikings, and the Crusaders. They may even survive to the present day as a Greek state with traces of Roman influence.

All cards are intended to be used with the 1550 Map Variant (see C1c). Use Reformist Theocracies for the starting England and HRE states, and the 2 new mapcards for the starting Hungary and Ottoman medieval states. Trebizond starts busted instead of the Red Sea. Replace the original Empire cards for Ottoman and Hungary with the new promo Empire cards, and only use the new Empire card for Papal States if the Papal States turns into a Reformation or Muslim Theocracy. The new Victory Square should be used in addition to the original ones, for a total of five Victory Squares. The new Banker overlay cards should be placed on top of an existing Banker placard (any Banker placard may be replaced). The new market cards should be mixed in with their respective deck.

Promo pack for Pax Renaissance 2nd ed. includes:

3 new Empire cards
9 new Market cards (5 west and 4 east)
1 new Victory Squares
2 new Map cards
2 new Banker overlay cards (Alvaro Mendes & Cornelius Berenberg)

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: CrowD Games, Galakta, Ion Game Design

name: Everdell: Kindergarten Promo Cards
description:
Everdell Kindergarten Promo cards :

This pack contains 6 cards that may be played with the original Everdell base game.

4X kids (critter card)
2X kindergarten (building card)

These cards are not meant for play with My lil' Everdell.

The Kindergarten card allows you to use an occupied token to play a Kids card for free, and you may do this twice during the game. If playing with Newleaf, you may not use two Golden occupied tokens on this card, though you may use one Golden occupied token and one normal occupied token.

Also contains 4 cards for my lil' everdell

2x My Lil' Everdell Main Deck Critter Cards* (Teacher and Coach)
2x My Lil' Everdell Main Deck Location Cards* (Kindergarten and Playground)
categories: Animals, Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement
publishers: Pegasus Spiele, Rebel Sp. z o.o., Starling Games (II)

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Challenge of the Wainriders
description:
Thane Ulchor has fled Ulfast, his trail leading directly to Mordor. Riding hard with the hope of overtaking him before he reaches the Black Land, your pursuit was aided at first by good weather and a clear trail. But fortune turned against you when you came upon a camp of Easterling Wainriders. Now at their mercy, you now have no choice but to accept a challenge unlike anything you have encountered in The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game.

Fantasy Flight Games is proud to announce Challenge of the Wainriders, the third Adventure Pack in the Vengeance of Mordor cycle for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game! In addition to providing new allies and tools to help you overcome the hardships you face as you draw ever-nearer to Mordor, this 60-card pack picks up where you left off in The City of Ulfast with a thrilling new scenario that will challenge your group of heroes like never before.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombicide Survivor: Benny
description:
Benny - The Children's Performer
"And now, boys and girls, let's give a big hand to Benny the Bear!"

Needing beer money, Benny answered an ad from a company specializing in children's parties. A star was born that day. a born thespian, Benny's repertoire included a bear, a knight, a giant, a talking zebra, and a friendly commando. He was at a children's party dressed as Captain Jack Action, the star of a popular children's TV show, when the zombies came. Benny's gun was a toy but like all great performers he improvised, fleeing the scene. He wears the costume to keep people from screwing with him and his acting skills make him much in demand amongst survivor groups...for awhile.

Benny is a promotional Survivor that was available to those that pledged extra during the Season 3 Kickstarter campaign. A Zombivor version is also included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Cool Mini Or Not, Guillotine Games

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Legendary Card Pack
description:
The long anticipated set of cards that fixes a number of typos that have long plagued our community! The Legendary Card pack also includes everything you need to upgrade your 1.5 core game to 1.6. This includes some balance adjustments, some replaced cards and maaaaybe even a new card or two!

This Card pack includes:

Card Typo Fixes for Core Game and Expansions
Minor content needed to upgrade a 1.5 Core game to 1.6
Promised content from selected single release figures
Promised content from Pinups of Death II collection
A surprise or two!


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Mature / Adult, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Arena: The Contest – Legendary Box
description: The Legendary Box contains all stretch goals from the initial Kickstarter campaign for Arena: The Contest (Imperial Box) as well as all expansions from the first campaign (Heroes & Dungeons, Harun the Shapeshifter, Hydra, Ascaran the Archangel & Vanarus the Demon, and The Elder Dragon).
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 10
description:
Inc0gn1t0 is a threat unlike any you've faced. Their identity and location are unknown, as are their demands. What is known is that they've hacked into networks across the city and we've found traces of a bomb that has some sort of remote access code. Can you stop them in time?

In this new expansion pack for Hostage Negotiator, you must deal with Inc0gn1t0's reign of terror across the city while trying to decrypt the code for the bomb. The more hostages you save the more time you buy for the decryption, but is it enough?

—description from the publisher

This Abductor pack is a 15 card expansion compatible with both Hostage Negotiator and Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 13 Kansas City
description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 13 Kansas City (V5) - Veteran Mix 5.
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That

name: Zombicide: Invader – Kabuki Gang Survivor Pack
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive set of 6 original Survivors designed by Adrian Smith, including their figures and ID cards.

The Kabuki Gang is an actual performance troupe that was touring the base when the Xenos attacked. The members of this troupe, most of them with rather shady pasts, didn't hesitate to pick up arms and face the invaders. Assuming the identity of the characters they were playing in their performance of Yotsuya Kaidan (including traditional wardrobe and masks), these actors scrambled to find whatever they could to help them in their fight. This means this group of Survivors each starts the game with an extra Equipment card, randomly drawn from the pile. The show, as they say, must go on!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Wizard's Quest
description: The Wizard's Quest is the Custom Scenario Kit for Gen Con 2018. It can be played cooperatively as well as competitively.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombicide: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Pack #1
description: Cool Mini or Not and IDW Games combine together to provide a set of survivors from the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles universe. This convention exclusive pack includes Leonardo, Donatello, Shredder, and Krang.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Deception: Murder in Hong Kong – Dice Tower 2017 Indiegogo Promo Pack
description:
6 new means cards:
Deck of cards
Shrimp
Train tracks
Remote Control
Shards of glass
Cement shoes
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Spirit Island: Bodenloser Schlamm der Sümpfe
description:
Fathomless Mud Of The Swamp likes having Sacred Sites where Invaders will Build, but may need to re-create those after oozing outwards with its Innate Power. In smaller games, might be able to cut off the most Inland lands from Explore actions by Destroying Inland Towns/Cities and stopping new ones from being built.
Causes a fair bit of Fear, much of which represents unpleasantness, hardship, and disgust.

This is a low-complexity spirit. It’s the same spirit as is included in Horizons of Spirit Island; in Germany, it was published on its own.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Sacred Bonds
description:
Sacred Bonds is the third monthly installment of fixed cards for the "A Clash of Arms" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, based on George R.R. Martin's bestselling Song of Ice and Fire saga. This Chapter Pack contains twenty different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame. (The first edition of this Chapter Pack included only one of each character card, while the second edition includes three copies of each card.)

The lone wolf dies, but the pack survives. With the realm in chaos, the leaders of the great Houses of Westeros are desperately searching for allies they can trust. Family honor, sacred oaths, and ties that are deeper than blood are invoked, because in Westeros, you are only as strong as those who watch your back.

"A Clash of Arms" cycle:

- The War of the Five Kings
- Ancient Enemies
- Sacred Bonds
- Epic Battles
- Battle of Ruby Ford
- Calling the Banners
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Galápagos Jogos, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: DreadBall: Season 2
description:
From Publisher's Site:

Lead your team to victory on the bloodstained pitches of the greatest sport ever played!

With a host of new models, new mechanics and exciting abilities, the Season 2 Rulebook takes DreadBall to new heights and expands your gameplay experience. Featuring brand new photography as well as a dedicated FAQ section, the Season 2 Rulebook is a must-have for any DreadBall fan.

Season 2 Expands your DreadBall Experience with:
•64 Page A4 Full Colour Rulebook
•4 New Teams
Judwan (humanoid aliens)
Z'zor (insectoids)
Void Sirens (human variant team - female)
Chromium Chargers (robots)
•9 famous MVPs
•Cheerleaders
•Coaches
•Talk Tactics FAQ
•League Play
•New Abilities
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Big Trouble in Little China: The Game – Legacy of Lo Pan
description:
Hey, wait a minute! This isn’t how it was supposed to go! You’re a reasonable person, but you’ve just experienced some very unreasonable things. For you it’s always in the reflexes, but not this time. You lost against Lo Pan and his minions today… but that doesn’t mean you gotta like it! Lo Pan’s plan was successful, he sacrificed Miao Yin and ascended to his trueform. But have no fear, Egg has a magical artifact called the Tardisian Hourglass that can transport you and your friends through time to stop him once and for all!

The Legacy of Lo Pan expansion increases the player count to up to 6 players who can now embark on an Epic adventure in the core game as well as experience the all-new quest book! You and your pals will play through the new time travel story campaign as you race through time to get all new special rewards to use in the new final showdown to defeat Lo Pan... again.

All of this content was available in Big Trouble in Little China: The Game – Deluxe Edition but now is being released by itself in its own packaging. The Deluxe edition also included the Six-Demon Bag and blank cards.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Alone: Alpha Expansion
description:
Sniper Hero Miniature and card
Anti Grav Hero Miniature and card
Alpha Parasite Miniature
Defense Droid Miniature
2 Mission Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – 5th Player Expansion
description:
This expansion makes adding a 5th hero to your Bat-team worry free.

Now unleash 4 vs 1 in 3 Adventure mode missions and take Justice to that lawbreaker.
The “Detective Comics “ series by James Tynion IV is the setting for these 3 missions, Batman assembles a new Bat-team led by Batwoman and featuring the skills and talents of Stephanie Brown, Cassandra Cain, Tim Drake and Basil Karlo.
5th player Adventure mode provides the Evil Masterminds side with some much-needed fortitude to stand up to the might of 4 heroes of Gotham. Villains have access to a larger reinforcement point pool and a boosted Energy Cube turn recovery amount, that lays a good foundation towards going toe to toe with the team and instigating their heinous plan.
Careful consideration during setup is key to a villain’s victory, as the evil mastermind, you have to ensure that your back up is up to the job. Remember that point when creating your own missions in ”Mission Maker “. Back up, Back, up, back up – make sure you have some – tough cookies too.
Setting inspired, Clayfaces’ hero screen rounds out the expansion and the team, with Batwoman leading the plays – these 3 missions drop you right into the comics timeline.

Mission 1 – Our Heroes face off the Court of Owls, aided by Cassandra’s father as they plan to awaken an entire army of Talons to wreak chaos and destruction in Gotham City – it’s your job to foil them.

Mission 2 – The head of the Demon, attended by Deathstroke plans Gotham’s downfall. His plan ? take out the city’s economic backbone, destroy the corruption it creates. Your Job – Guard and Prevent.

Mission 3 - The St Dumas Order’s final creation is awakening – the team faces the Azrael assassins and the artificial intelligence Ascalon. It’s your job to lay waste to this order once and for all.

More Missions for this dedicated team will roll out, fully supporting 5 player mode into the future in addition to expanding the mission roster even further.

—description from the publisher

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Das letzte Lagerfeuer
description:
This card is part of the Spielbox magazine issue 01/2013.

It is a single card expansion for Legends of Andor to be used with Legends 2-5 to slightly reduce the difficulty of the legends.

RULES:
At the beginning of the game a dice roll decides at which point the card comes into play. According to the dice value the card will be placed besides the legend bar. The card is activated if the narrator reaches this point of the legend bar.

The card allows all players to give and receive willpower and strength with the other players. Any number of points can be moved among the players. The heroes do not need to be in the same zone. A hero must always have at least 1 willpower and 1 strength left.

If other events happen at this point of the legend bar, this card always happens last.

name: ASL Action Pack #13: ASL Oktoberfest XXXII
description:
The ASLOK XXXII pack builds on the success of the ASL Oktoberfest XXX pack, and highlights the design and playtesting talents of Ohio’s finest. Guided by veteran playtesters and tournament directors Bret Hildebran and Bill Hayward, the expert scenario designers Bill Sisler and Pete Shelling bring us eleven scenarios ranging from 1939 Poland to 1945 Hungary, with stops in Ukraine, Russia, New Guinea, Burma, Italy, France, and Belgium along the way. Place names like Vistula, Balta, Luga, Bougainville, Myitkyina, Elba, Caen, Falaise, and Bastogne will all ring a bell. These scenarios will stretch your tactical knowledge and skills, with many different situations (although no night actions—so sad). Some are infantry only, one is armor only (almost), but most feature combined arms. Assault engineers with all their toys are featured, and the King of Battle makes its appearance in the form of offboard artillery in several scenarios. Along with the “typical” Russian, German, and American battles, these scenarios also involve Poles (both 1939 and 1944 versions), British, Japanese, Chinese, the Free French, and the SS (of all different squad types).

The two new boards bring added flexibility to the system and are integral to most of the scenarios. Board 78 is a true wilderness board (no buildings) featuring a brush-covered ridge along its length. Board 79 provides a new river, three to five hexes wide, with a village strung out along both banks. Both highlight the steady skills of Charlie Kibler and are sure to see wide use in future scenario design. With great boards and great scenarios, Action Pack #13 is sure to be a big hit.

—description from the publisher

mechanics: Hexagon Grid

The set also includes new characters, equipment, supplies, events and scenery to expand your regular games.

It also contains brand new rules for linking multiple games as a campaign, allowing your characters to take injuries, earn experience, and find new equipment!
