name: Fallen: Kickstarter Edition
description:
Fallen is a card and dice game in which two players battle deep within a dungeon. One player takes on the role of the Hero, exploring the twisting halls and deadly chambers of the labyrinth. Another player takes on the role of the Dungeon Lord, summoning monstrous creatures and wielding dark magic.

The adventure is brought to life through an array of cards and dice. As players explore the dungeon, Store Cards describe the rooms and challenges the Hero will face. When a battle erupts or a trap is sprung, Challenge Dice are rolled to see who is victorious.

The adventure culminates in an epic battle between the Hero and the Dungeon Lord with only one player left standing.

The Kickstarter Edition of the game includes 50 additional story cards plus new heroes (Adren the Knight, Cael Oathbringer the Priest, and Rivern the Huntress) and new dungeon lord characters (Norathra the Forsaken, Spider Queen, and Sythean the Devourer).

Specifically this includes:


50 Story Cards
3 Advanced Hero Character Cards
3 Advanced Dungeon Lord Character Cards
23 Creature Cards
27 Hero Skill cards
4 Basic Equipment cards
13 Treasure cards
30 Power cards (Hero)
30 Power cards (Dungeon Lord)
8 Omen cards
42 Final Battle cards
3 Sythean Creature cards
6 Sythean Critical cards
3 Cael Rune cards
12 Cael Rune tokens
4 Norathra Blood Vine tokens
1 Rivern Mark token
1 Blood token

1 Spider Queen Web card
10 Spider Queen Web tokens

name: Batman: The Animated Series Adventures – Villain Upgrade Pack Expansion
description:
New to the Adventures Universal Game System are "Rogues Gallery" class dice, which offer a whole new level of flexibility when playing as a hero! Normally, hero characters have one set of custom dice that is balanced for them to have a particular play style. However, villains are a bit more slippery than that. With class dice, you can change the way your character plays. Want to play The Joker as the traditional slick footed trickster? Then use the "Wildcard" dice! Want to switch it up and show how deadly he can be with a blunt object? Then swap in the "Brawler" dice (better watch out, Robin). Combining different Rogues Gallery class dice with your character's various hero skill cards generates even more ways to customize their play style.

In addition to the 12 new dice, the Villains Upgrade Pack comes with 10 Hero Sheets: The Joker, Mr. Freeze, Killer Croc, Poison Ivy, Harley Quinn, Two-Face, Penguin, Scarecrow, Jervis Tetch, and The Riddler, a set of Hero Skill cards for those 10 characters, totaling 72 new Skill cards, 9 A.I. Villain sheets for Batman, Robin, Batgirl, Commissioner Gordon, Detective Montoya, Detective Bullock, Nightwing, Tim Drake, and the GCPD beat cops, and 25 initiative cards.

On top of all that, the Villain Upgrade Pack also contains a new mission book. Based on the episode Almost Got 'Im, this mission book delivers a new campaign type: a skirmish campaign. Skirmish campaigns have multiple hero players and multiple villains players using all characters on the board in their hero playstyle, rolling dice and strategizing with their teammates. In Almost Got 'Im a team of villains and a team of heroes will square off to settle the score once and for all. Players that want to keep things strictly cooperative can play this campaign in the cooperative A.I. mode.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Die Icon Resolution, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Iron Helm: The Fanny Pack
description:
The Fanny Pack is a booster packs meant to enhance the base game of Iron Helm. You will need a copy of the base game of Iron Helm to enjoy this pack. The Fanny Pack adds new Characters, Trappings, Loot, Enemies, Plots, and more to the base game.

Simply add the cards from this pack to your base game. You can always use the icons at the top of the card to remove this pack at a later time if you ever want to return the base game to its original form, but I doubt you will...

The included Artifact Card requires the expansion Iron Chest to be used.

name: Zombicide: Black Plague – Troy and Evil Troy
description:
2 new Survivors for Zombicide: Black Plague (including their miniatures and ID cards).

Description from the publisher:

Troy
Troy doesn’t belong in this kingdom, and he never really meant to get into the zombie-slaying business at all. But now that he’s here, now that he has no option but to swing his sword around rather than swinging around bales of hay, well, he’s going to be the best zombie-slayer there is. Maybe win himself a princess in the process, a small castle… There’s something to be said for being a hero, Troy is discovering, especially when it comes with lovely wenches and pocketfuls of gold. Of course, he has to survive all the zombies first.

Evil Troy
The necromancers have performed many experiments in their quest for the perfect evil, the perfect zombie. One of the worst things they managed was a simulacrum of a living being. This golem remembers everything the original human, Troy, knew; he has all of Troy’s skills. But he is as undead as a zombie, as angry as a raging bull, and as absolutely evil as it is possible to be. Evil Troy is a nasty piece of work, to put it shortly, intent on killing anything – human, zombie, or necromancer – that gets in his way.

description:
Contains 27 additional cards for Millennium Blades, including two sets with a board game theme.

The Kartes des Jares Premium set and Bro'kin's Best Master set give you a variety of cards and effects inspired by popular board games! Use The Blades to gain the power to duel and clash with players every turn! The Galactic Trendsettlers will help you turn your RP into a variety of resources, including RP! The Sanctuary Deck Box lets you remove useless cards from your deck and gain RP in the process!

This mini-expansion also contains an additional card for the Millennium Masters set from the base game as well as an additional card for Bro'kin's Best! Pay tribute with enough Stars to Eeuroe the Kingmaker and gain his friendship for victory points! Fishy Boat: Legacy adds a new version of Fishy Boat with a legacy element!

Five new influence cards indicate for which player the King's pieces score. Additionally, each player has three special action cards which allow them to break certain rules when surrendered.

name: Campaign Trail: Green Party Expansion
description:
This edition of the Green Party Expansion contains voter tokens compatible with the original Campaign Trail base game from Cosmic Wombat Games. It also includes Timed Releases and a larger box and tray designed to contain both the base game and the Green Party Expansion.

Campaign Trail is a highly reviewed, card-driven strategy game of electoral politics where players compete to win their candidate the presidency.

The Green Party Expansion adds more action cards, more candidates, new global events, and end game goals that introduce new strategies and allows more players to compete for the White House!

Now playable with up to 4 parties and up to 8 players, the Green Party Expansion allows you to challenge more of your rivals for political victory.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Political
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Cthulhu Wars: Beyond Time and Space
description:
More monsters and terror!

Components:


4 Wamp Miniatures
2 Voonith Miniatures
Hound of Tindalos figure
3 Loyalty Cards


Vooniths are an “amphibious horror” referenced by Lovecraft in his tale, The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath. Pretty much nothing else is known of them. The design of the Voonith upon sirens and amphisboenas – these are existing amphibians & reptiles who only have forelegs. So the back half of the Voonith is long & eel-like, while the front part has claws and fangs. The model shows it rearing up, ready to strike. They cost 3 Power, and only have 1 Combat, which may at first seem puny, but wait, there’s more!

The Voonith is a solitary hunter, and I wanted the in-game version to foster that concept. Therefore, its special ability is that if you roll NO kills in a battle involving your Voonith, add 1 kill to your total. Because of this, the Voonith’s 1 combat die isn’t actually a drawback. If you have 2 Vooniths and roll no kills, you’d get 2 kills for free. And yes, if you have 2 Vooniths in Battle and roll only 1 kill, you get a free kill for your deficit. Basically, each Voonith you have provides a guaranteed kill!

—description from the publisher

The Hound of Tindalos, Wamp, and Voonith sculpts are credited to "Tidal 4".
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

Cetra, Guide of Ogo

name: G.I. JOE Deck-Building Game: New Alliances – A Transformers Crossover Expansion
description:
Earth is thrust into danger when a new menace arrives in the form of giant robots capable of hiding in plain sight! Of course Cobra is involved, but this time they aren't the biggest problem–not by a long shot. If the Joes are going to have a chance to save the planet, they’ll need equally big allies to face this new threat!

In this special Transformers crossover expansion, the Joes will roll out with new Autobot friends like Bumblebee and Optimus Prime as they take on the evil Decepticons and their sinister Cobra cronies, led by Old Snake!

Features:

G.I. JOE teams up with the Autobots!
A new crossover Mission with Space Bridge tile!
New Autobot cards to recruit as allies! They can go on missions in their bot mode without requiring transport, OR in their alt vehicle mode where they'll be able to haul members of the JOE team along.
New Ark component and Energon dice pool that must be managed to fuel Autobot skills and tech.
Constructicons make cards more expensive to recruit, and if 6 are ever in play simultaneously, you'll have to take on the mighty Devastator!
And more!


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Carson City: The Lawyer / Editor
description:
This surprise personality card is made especially for the 10th anniversary of Quined Games. On the cards’ art you can see Arno, the founder and owner of Quined Games. During the day he is a lawyer and during the evening he is an editor. Enjoy playing with this character, here are the rules on how to use him.

The Lawyer may immediately buy a parcel not owned by any player. He pays the normal price. In addition, nobody can contest the lawyer from buying a parcel. In case of a duel with the Lawyer
for buying a parcel, the challenging cowboy goes back to the personal reserve of this player, before the duel is resolved. For all other actions, duels against the lawyer are resolved as
usual. Cash limit : $60.

The Editor publishes a story inspired by your success. At the end of the income phase (round 1/2/3/4), you win a victory point for every $5 / $10 / $15 / $20 of income from all your buildings, rounded up. You do not earn points on income from the attacks of other players buildings or on the money other players would have robbed you. Example: in round 2, you get a total income of 33$ from your buildings, so you earn 4 victory points. Cash limit: $40.

---

Note: As these are included in the Big Box of Carson City, this small expansion is meant for owners of the base game.
The Lawyer/Editor was also a giveaway together with the Teacher at Essen but without the Townhall.

name: Supermarina I: Command at Sea Volume II
description:
The War in the Mediterranean 1939-1941.

While Rommel's Afrika Korps was capturing the attention of the world, it's fate was being decided in the Mediterranean. No matter how good the general and his troops, without the supplies and equipment necessary to fight, the struggle could not be won. Supermarina I concerns itself with the struggle for naval supremacy in the Mediterranean Sea, the vital supply link for the Axis forces in North Africa.

Supermarina I is a tactical naval combat game system utilizing award winning designer Larry Bond's Game: Command at Sea rules system and is the first of a projected three part treatment of the naval war in the Mediterranean.

Supermarina I contains a 64 page Scenario Book with 20 scenarios covering the action from the war's start through June, 1941.
The ships represented in the scenarios range from E-Boats to aircraft carriers and battleships (140 total ships). The ship and aircraft Data Annex (96 pages) covers all the units present in the first half of the war. Over 400 aircraft and ship die-cut counters are included.
Additionally , you get the 3rd Edition Standard Rules (128 pages) punched for a three ring binder. A jump-start scenario and a scenario generator are also included in this boxed set.
categories: Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

description:
Yet another body has been uncovered in the Black Cave. With due diligence, you seek the truth and believe the mastermind of the murders is a congressman, Mr. Grey. This is an unprecedented case for you. Will you be able to take down such a powerful politician and his ring of conspirators?

By the Book is a special print-and-play challenge scenario for Arkham Horror: The Card Game designed to be played with Roland Banks.

This scenario can be played as either a standalone scenario or as a side-story inserted into any campaign. In order to play this scenario, a copy of the Core Set and the printed print-and-play files are required.

The print-and-play files can be downloaded in the Support Section at the end of this page: https://www.fantasyflightgames.com/en/products/arkham-horror... in the Print-and-Play Cards section.

name: Rum & Bones: Second Tide – Hammers of Ragnarok
description:
The worlds of Vikings and Pirates are about to collide!

There are few crews on the high seas more feared than the Hammers of Ragnarok. These sea-faring Vikings rejoice in the violence and bloodshed in battle. The only thing better than earning valuable booty from their raids would be to die in battle.

The Hammers of Ragnarok are a complete expansion faction for Rum and Bones Second Tide with their own Heroes, Tide cards, Deckhands, and ships. Any pirate out there will be quaking in their pantaloons when they spot the Hammers’ colors flying.

This is an expansion. The Rum & Bones: Second Tide core box is required to play.

Features:


Long Ships - The Hammers of Ragnarok have their own long ships for engaging in battle with rival pirate forces!
Viking Heroes - Five new Viking Heroes will lead their forces to take home some shiny pirate treasure or die in glorious battle. They’re fine either way.
High Tide - With their own Tide deck to draw on for support, the Hammers of Ragnarok will be a force to be reckoned with!

description: A boxed expansion set to Dungeon Saga, The Tyrant of Halpi comes complete with a Quest Book with all-new scenarios, Ibrahim and Ally miniatures with Hero Cards, and a Karrathor Dragon miniature with Boss Card. The Tyrant of Halpi also introduces new dungeon tiles, spells, items, and locations, as well as cards to support Invisible Overlord and Uncharted Dungeon play modes.

name: Champions of Hara: Chaos On Hara
description:
Shadows have fallen over Hara; the bastion of beauty and free expression has become warped by powers of its own design. With so many strong-willed souls all creating in one space, it was only a matter of time before the edges started to crack. Now the evil serpent, Doubt, is spreading, corrupting paradise from within. Dark Rifts are emerging to poison the land around them, and the Kensei, Hara's stewards, are becoming increasingly demanding of the poor souls that have been brought to this world.

Chaos On Hara, an expansion to Champions Of Hara, adds four new playable characters, along with the components necessary for five and six player games. Go deeper into the world of Hara with new Monsters and Event cards for each World, and face off against four vicious new Corrupted foes. This expansion also contains sixteen new Scenarios for you to fight your way through, including four new solo Scenarios and four ultra-hard "Challenges From The Void".
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000: Conquest – Unforgiven
description:
From the publisher:

“Repent! For your doom is at hand.”
–Epistolary Vezuel, Dark Angels Librarian

Unforgiven is the second War Pack in the Death World cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest.

In the carnivorous jungles of Nectavus VI, a fearsome Dark Angels psyker leads his battle-brothers through a gauntlet of death. Flora and fauna are stirred by the Warp to attack anything that moves, even as the skies above open in a gateway directly into the Immaterium. Nectavus VI is one of the most dangerous worlds in the Traxis sector, yet it too may become the center of a massive battle to determine the fate of the galaxy.

Unforgiven is the second War Pack in the Death World cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest, and like the other packs of this cycle, you’ll find plenty of support for the new Deep Strike keyword. By Deep Striking your units, attachments, or events, you’ll be able to arrive at the battlefield without alerting the enemy to your presence. You’ll also find new support for each faction’s Elite units, ensuring that these massive units have a comparable impact on the battlefield. Finally, this War Pack introduces a new Space Marines warlord and his signature squad that can take full advantage of the new Deep Strike keyword!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Galakta, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Warhammer 40,000: Conquest – Jungles of Nectavus
description:
From the publisher:

“This planet is a hellhole, but it’ll be an Imperial hellhole when we’re through with it.”
–Lieutenant Zhaebin, Vostroyan Firstborn

Jungles of Nectavus is the first War Pack in the Death World cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest.

For much of the Imperium, a Death World is a place you will never see—and never want to see. On Nectavus VI, the entire planet is covered by jungle, and everything in that jungle is trying to kill you. The trees and vines spray poisonous spikes at whatever comes near. The animals that dwell within the jungle can strike invisibly from the shadows or simply use their brute strength and unreasoning resilience to crush their foes. Nectavus VI is an unquestionable Death World, yet it is about to become the site of another massive battle for the Traxis sector…

Jungles of Nectavus is the first War Pack in the Death World cycle, and as such, it serves as an introduction to the themes and mechanics that pervade the rest of the cycle. Here, every faction enters the jungles of Nectavus VI, and you’ll need to embrace new tactics to survive in such a hostile environment. On this world, drawing attention to yourself can be a death sentence, so a new keyword allows you to deploy your cards secretly, only revealing them as the battle is about to begin. The Death World cycle also brings a new focus to each factions’ Elite units, making them a more integral part of your armies than ever before!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Galakta, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Prophecy: Water Realm

In Prophecy: Water Realm, the second expansion for the Prophecy fantasy adventure game, you will be invited to enter another astral sphere. Dive into unknown depths and try to recover mighty artifacts guarded by mythical monsters and deadly water maelstroms. If you venture deep into the Water Realm, you'll return with pockets full of gold and treasure - assuming you manage to return, that is.

That's not all! There is an isolated island where the most famous pirate of all time hides the most powerful items ever created by a human. During your adventures, search for fragments of an old map that show you the way to the treasure.

name: Star Wars: Legion – Chewbacca Operative Expansion
description:
Han Solo’s ever-faithful companion, Chewbacca isn’t afraid to follow his friends into battle. Once there, it isn’t hard to see how he can aid the three Rebel commanders as they attempt to capture crucial objectives or secure a foothold on the battlefield. His immense strength and personal connection to Han Solo, Luke Skywalker, and Leia Organa make him a natural choice to join these iconic heroes on the battlefield as an operative.

Inside the Chewbacca Operative Expansion, you’ll find everything you need to add Chewbacca to your Rebel army. A single unpainted, easily assembled miniature depicts Chewbacca roaring into battle, his trusty bowcaster at the ready. Three upgrade cards provide more tools for preparing Chewbacca and your other units for battle, and three command cards can add more variety to your hand, allowing Chewbacca to team up with the three Rebel commanders.

—description from the publisher

Superclub expansion requires base game to play, skills to win, and nothing more than a pulse to thoroughly enjoy.

The Rosari Clan Expansion includes all the components needed to add a 5th player to the Vengeance base game. It also adds a new gang, the vicious Rosari Clan.

The Rosari are either added to the game in 5 player setups or are swapped for existing gangs in lower player counts.  This expansion also adds a new Hero: Reverend Gray.  Gray is hell-bent on stopping the Rosari's rampant recruitment of youth in his city. With God and a bottle of bourbon on his side, what could go wrong?

Shadows of Brimstone: Derelict Ship Artifacts Game Supplement is pretty much what it says, a 15-card supplement for Shadows of Brimstone: Other Worlds – Derelict Ship.

Description from the publisher:

Futuristic weapons and gear from the mysterious Derelict Ship almost seem like magic to heroes of the Old West. But given some dangerous trial and error, they can often quickly figure out which end fires the laser or which button activates the tech. In the right hands, this technology can turn the tables on deadly demons and creatures from the void! This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Derelict Ship Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around the futuristic technology found in the dark corridors and cold rooms of the Derelict Ship.

Screaming through the atmosphere on nimble ailerons, the TIE/sk striker is a unique starfighter designed to excel at both air and space assaults. name: Wings of Glory: WW1 – Ace Cards Promo Pack
description:
With this promo pack, you can add historical Ace pilots to your Wings of Glory games!

WW1 Wings of Glory rules now include "Ace skills" and how to use them. A pilot (or other crew member) may now be an Ace, and each Ace may have one or more special abilities. These abilities "break the rules", and give to his plane additional bonus and special capabilities - for example, ignoring certain jamming results, getting an aim bonus, getting away with risky maneuvers.

The Ace Cards included in the Promo Pack go even further, by presenting real WW1 pilots and giving to each of them a selection of Ace abilities based on actual historical documents of their fighting skills. The pack includes 7 famous personalities: the "Red Baron" Manfred Von Richthofen, Max Immelmann, Willy Coppens, Silvio Scaroni, Lanoe George Hawker, Jean Navarre and Frank Luke.

Each Ace is represented by a card with his photo, indicating the period in his career which is represented by the card's abilities, as well as historical data about him (including the number of recorded victories), and his skills.

The skills are then presented in individual cards, each card including the description of the skill and how it modifies the Wings of Glory rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Elites
description:
The Kill Team: Elites expansion is a 144-page softback book that includes the following contents:

- 67 new datasheet introducing a host of new Commanders and special operatives, ranging from Space Marines clad in Terminator armour to the deadly Aspect Warriors of the Asuryani – there are even datasheets for a number of unique Commanders such as Illic Nightspear, Boss Snikrot and the legendary Sly Marbo!
- A new faction in the form of the mighty Adeptus Custodes, featuring Custodian Guard, Allarus Custodians and even a Shield-Captain as a Commander
- Sub-faction rules such as Legion Traits, Regimental Doctrines and Drukhari Obsessions as well as thematic Tactics immerse your kill teams ever deeper into the narrative
- Introduces a new Commander Specialism – Legendary Hunter – complete with skill tree and Tactics
- 11 new missions (3 open play, 4 narrative play and 4 matched play)

You will need the Kill Team Core Manual to use this expansion, as well as the Kill Team: Commanders expansion if you wish to use any of the Commanders datasheets.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Edge of Darkness: Emissaries of the Vale
description:
Welcome to the Vale, home of the staunch Druids of the Clans.

For too long have the Realm of Humans and the Vale been at odds. As the Blight threatens to extend its influence deep into the Valley of Life, the Druids finally decide to set aside their distrust of humans borne of the unholy union of the Necromancer King and the sister of Gaia, the Crone. They reach out for help, pleading for appeasement and in return, druid and humans from all creeds (Aegis, Dunestar, Coldharbor) finally stand united. Reclaim what was once lost and destroy the Blight once and for all!

Emissaries of the Vale is the third expansion to Edge of Darkness, and furthers the variety offered by its unique blend of worker placement and card crafting to help you bring your guild to victory thanks to its 13 unique location boards and associated advantages. Send your agents broken peace with the Druids at the Stem of the Clans, find and defeat the mighty Betrayer of the Vale in the depths of the Untamed Forest and marvel at the myriad of creatures living under the protection of Gaia in this fully compatible expansion.

—description from the back of the box
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – 7 Card Promo Pack
description: Baseball Highlights 2045: 7-Card Promo Pack Includes: 2 Travel Stadium Cards, 1 Mordecai Marichal Card, 2 Kris Correa Cards (1 Foil), 2 Wiffle's Revenge Cards (1 Foil).
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That

name: HEXplore It: The Valley of the Dead King – Encounter Deck
description:
This Encounter Deck adds a new way to play the Valley of the Dead King. All previously existing encounters from the Core Box, the Expansion, and the Living Card deck are reprinted with epic new art!

These decks add a new way to play the game by separating the Encounters into their own deck. Additionally, these encounters are not restricted to the volume they originally appeared in, allowing you to add and customize what encounters will appear in any volume you play.

Contents include:

Rules insert describing this new playstyle
32 Full art encounters

Boons offer new and increased rewards on the next Encounter you face!

Game Difficulty increase cards. Each deck will come with 3 Game Difficulty increase cards.

Conditions/Keyword list: Add conditions that appeared exclusively in certain volumes to any game.

Role variations: updated rules for the Roles who Summon Encounters

How do Boons work exactly?
Boons are newly introduced in Domain of Mirza Noctis. When you draw one of these from the Encounter deck, you’ll draw another card. If it is another Boon, you keep drawing. If the last card drawn is an Encounter, you’ll gain extra rewards after battle. If the card is not an Encounter(a difficulty increase for instance), you’ll shuffle the Boons back into the Encounter deck. Boons offer new and increased rewards!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Troll
description:
Description from the publisher:

Do you want to add a fearsome and slightly absurd Troll to your Orcish Blood Bowl team? Or maybe a Goblin team? You’ve come to the right place. This excellent multi-part plastic kit contains the parts you need to assemble a rather large Troll (look at him – he’s wearing a human’s helmet as a knee pad, for Nuffle’s sake), winding up to fling a Goblin into the end zone.

Supplied with a 32mm Blood Bowl round base, featuring a hole to slot the ball into when he has possession.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Excelsior Expansion Pack
description:
The U.S.S. Excelsior was a 23rd century prototype vessel used for conducting scientific missions and for testing new technological equipment.
Under the command of Captain Styles, it was the first ship that attempted to employ the experimental Transwarp Drive.
Later, under the command of Captain Hikaru Sulu, it conducted a three year mission exploring gaseous atmospheric anomalies in the Beta Quadrant.
This expansion ads a new ship and new cards to Star Trek Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Twilight Struggle: "Referendum NATO" Promo Card
description:
A promo card published by Devir for the release of the Spanish Edition of Twilight Struggle.

Card number "111 Optional".

Neutral Event - Late War - 1 ops

Requires NATO.

Each player rolls a die. The active player adds +1 and the player with more influence in Spain/Portugal also adds +1. In case of a tie, roll again. The winner adds 1 VP and adds 1 influence in Spain/Portugal. If the winner is the USSR, cancel the effects of NATO for Spain/Portugal.

Remove from play if used as event.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dark Blue Defection (fan expansion for Red Storm)
description:
Red Storm: Dark Blue Defection is an unofficial solo expansion designed for use with GMT’s Red Storm – The Air War Over Germany, 1987, game of operational level air combat between NATO and the Warsaw Pact. Please note, this solo expansion is not a GMT Games product.

Red Storm: Dark Blue Defection provides a solo only experience in which each scenario can be set up and played to conclusion in one evening. The scenarios require no planning. The forces involved are pre-set to allow speed of play.

Red Storm: Dark Blue Defection modifies the solo bot provided in Red Storm and provides a set of 10 smaller scenarios designed to be played in sequence with increased difficulty and a ramp up of game rules as they progress to allow learning of the game systems detailed in the Red Storm Rules of Play in a logical and fun way.

As the Player, you will play as NATO through a series of challenging connected scenarios. The Warsaw Pact forces are controlled by the Bot System.

Scenarios featuring mission types from Red Storm include close air support, interdiction, SEAD, deep strike, raid defense and a new air heist mission type.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fast Sloths: Promo Set – Chameleon
description:
Fast Sloths: Promo Set – Chameleon is a small card expansion for Fast Sloths.

In Fast Sloths, the Chameleon cannot only change colors, it will act as a joker for all animals joining the race.

For now, this promo set will be released exclusively at SPIEL 2019.

description: This box contains all the Kickstarter stretch goals and extras for Starcadia Quest. It includes: Campaign Sheet Pad, 32 miniatures, 23 hero cards, 13 monster cards, 21 quest cards, and 4 plastic dashboard trays.

name: Elder Sign: The Log of the Persephone – Promotional Adventure Card
description:
The Log of the Persephone is a mail order card from Fantasy Flights Games. The card can only be acquired by using the order form in the back of the novel 'Bones of the Yopasi' also by FFG.

The card provides a new location for Elder Sign based on the Novel.

Update March 30 2013: The card was (sparsely) given away on TableTopDay by retailers who received the goodie-box.

Update February 5th 2014: The card was found in the gift bags sent out to backers of Season 1 of Shut Up & Sit Down
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Gloomhaven: The End of the World (Promo Scenario)
description:
This is a digital, single-scenario promo item for Gloomhaven. After players fail a scenario, instead of retrying it, they can instead play this scenario to retroactively count the other as a victory, but the cost for losing is steep.

This scenario also adds a new mechanic of "taken" cards, where players lose cards to a separate stack, and these cards can only be recovered through a specific action.

The scenario is available for free via the No Pun Included website.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Murky Confrontations Game Supplement
description:
Description from the publisher:

The murky Swamps of Jargono are filled with terrifying creatures, man-eating plants, and massively over-sized insects, all ready to feed on unsuspecting travelers that stray into their path. Ancient stone ruins of lost civilizations sink into the swamp, while brutal, tribal warnings dedicated to the Serpent God mark territory best left unmolested; and the suffocating humidity hangs in the air sapping your strength.

This 15-card OtherWorld Jargono Encounter Supplement is themed for the deadly plants and creatures that dwell in the thick and murky swamplands of Jargono. Creeping vines overgrow the pathways, while bubbling bogs broil beneath your feet, only disturbed by the rippling on the water’s surface of yet more terrifying beasts approaching.

CONTENTS

Card #120 Lost Civilizations ×2
Card #121 Suffocating Humidity ×2
Card #122 Overgrown Path
Card #123 Brutal Warning
Card #124 Man-Eater Worms
Card #125 Dying Native
Card #126 Visage of the Serpent God
Card #127 Verdant Spring
Card #128 Creeper Vines
Card #129 Sticky Eggs
Card #130 Bubbling Bog
Card #131 Ripplers on the Surface
Card #132 Glow Moths

mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

description:
Description from the publisher:

The Mekasylum, an expansion for the game The World of Smog: Rise of Moloch, introduces new mechanics and brings a new three-mission campaign to Rise of Moloch and comes with:

3 Heroes (Archibald Argrave, Miss Liddel and Little Alice)
3 Agents (Signore Gepetto, Pinokio and Little Orphan Lily)
8 Minion Miniatures (Killer Toys)
Tiles to explore the Unicorn Club

name: World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Artumnis Moondream Character Pack
description:
In the world of Warcraft, there are many heroes and many perils. As each foe falls, a new enemy is revealed; as each hero falters, a new champion stands forth. Now, a new hero has risen to take his place in the Hall of Legends!

Artumnis Moondream, a Night Elf druid, possesses the power and ferocity of the bear. By harnessing his druidic powers, he may assume bear form to increase his durability and strength. By calling on the spirits of nature, he may heal himself, trap escaping foes, and strike his enemies at range.

This expansion pack contains;

* 28 Challenge Cards
* 23 Ability Cards
* 9 Character Tokens
* 4 Character Cards
* 1 Character Miniature
* 4 Quests
* 4 Discovery Tokens

Expansion for:


World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game

description:
The Paperboy miniature was available for free to early backers of Scarface 1920, or as an add-on for an addition fee if you weren't an early backer.

The figure replaces the time marker token, but it also comes with three exclusive News cards to add to the game.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Tactical Cube 138 Expansion Pack
description:
The Borg Class 4 tactical vessel was a type of heavily-armed Borg cube utilized by the Borg Collective. The tactical cube differed from the standard Borg cube in several ways, the most notable being the extensive hull armor that covered a large portion of the exterior hull of the ship. The interior was also slightly altered from what is known of Borg "architecture". The vessel's central plexus was protected by multi-regenerative security fields.

This ship is part of the 5th wave of expansion packs for the Star Trek: Attack Wing game.

description:
New companion card for Clank!

During setup, shuffle this card into the Dungeon Deck. This card can be used with any clank board but is most effective with the expansion boards.

Text:
This turn, if you take a Curse, enter a flooded room, mine a gold vein, or take a web token, gain 2 gold.

Originally contained in Level Up Loot: One

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Assault on Icecrown Citadel Raid Deck
description:
From the World of Warcraft TCG site:

Experience raiding content through the World of Warcraft Trading Card Game. Play the role of a hero as your storm Icecrown Citadel with your friends against the evil that has plagued Northrend for too long. Or, play as that evil and conquer the world!

This four-player game has everything you and three friends need to play all in the box. Play as Highlord Tirion Fordring, Lady Jaina Proudmoore, or Queen Sylvanas Windrunner and battle against the Lich King! Each player takes a deck, and the three heroes of Azeroth team-up to free the land from the threats of Icecrown Citadel. If the 3-on-1 seems unfair, know that the Lich King raid deck has some of the most powerful cards you've ever seen. He's no mere mortal! Plus, each deck comes with the hero's legendary weapon: the Ashbringer, Staff of Antonidas, Frostmourne, and Deathwhisper. The decks also feature new art for Fire Blast, Frostbolt, Counterspell, Multi-Shot, Redemption, Hammer of Justice, and others!

Cryptozoic has streamlined the raid deck experience, making it far more friendly to new players. There are no new rules to learn; each player takes his or her turn just as they would in a normal game of World of Warcraft TCG. The included rulebook ensures that even completely green recruits can jump in the action.

The three raiding decks easily convert into tournament-legal Core decks as well. Just replace the hero card, remove the legendary weapon, and you can battle at your local Core Constructed or Battlegrounds event.

Each four-player game comes packaged with an Assault on Icecrown Citadel Treasure Pack, and the Treasure Packs are sold separately as well. There are 20 uncommons, 7 rares, and 3 epics in the set. Each pack contains 9 foil cards (8 uncommons and 1 rare or 1 epic) unleashing never-seen-before allies, abilities, quests, and equipment cards into the World of Warcraft TCG card pool. Find Muradin Bronzebeard, High Overlord Saurfang, and Highlord Tirion Fordring as new allies to join your party. Recruit the best of Northrend before you go back to the mainland. You also have the chance to open Loot cards from Worldbreaker: Mottled Drake, Grim Campfire, and Landro's Lil XT.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Cryo Interactive Entertainment, Cryptozoic Entertainment, Upper Deck Entertainment

name: Full Metal Planete: Plateau Modulaire
description: You thought you knew all about Full Metal Planete? Thanks to these 19 modules made of rigid cardboard, positionable in an infinity of combinations, you will be able to compose and discover tens of thousands of unknown sectors of this mythical planet. You want a rather mountainous plateau, or a marsh? You prefer a large river, or a chaotic archipelago? It is up to you to decide. This box also contains additional rules as well as 19 elements of 37 hexagons.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: Batman: The Animated Series Adventures – Mask of the Phantasm Expansion
description:
The Mask of the Phantasm story pack adds Bruce Wayne as a new playable hero, and the Phantasm, who can be played as either a villain or hero. In the Mask of the Phantasm campaign, the Phantasm operates like a third faction in each battle. While not directly opposing the heroes, the Phantasm isn't exactly allied with them either. Each battle in Mask of the Phantasm will have the heroes trying to stop the villains, while also racing against the shadowy threat of the Phantasm! Bruce Wayne comes with a Hero Sheet and 6 Hero Skill cards, the Phantasm comes with a Hero Sheet, 6 Hero Skill cards, a A.I. Villain Sheet, a 4v1 Villain Sheet, and 6 Villain Ability cards, and the mission book includes a 3-battle campaign following the events of the motion picture.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The World of SMOG: Rise of Moloch – The Wheel
description:
There are shadowy plots at work in London, beyond even those of the sinister Cult of Imhotep and its Agents. Ancient forces, who view the smog choked streets and its corrupted masses as anathema to the natural balance of the world, have arisen in the heart of London.

These are the followers of The Wheel.

Calling forth primal magics, this band of gypsies, witches, and fay now seek to cleanse this black spot from the natural realm- by any means necessary.

The Wheel, an expansion for the game The World of Smog: Rise of Moloch, brings a new missions to Rise of Moloch and comes with:

2 Heroes (Reverend Dudley and Mrs. Dudley);
4 Agents (Nibaba, Baba Yaga the Witch, Divio Juckal and Cobblestone Golem);
1 New Minion x8 (The Night Creatures);
Tiles

name: Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness – Rise of the Undead Dragon
description:
A new danger threatens the land of Drunagor: soaring on soundless wings, a horrifying drake has returned from beyond the gates of death itself to ravage the countryside and establish its own reign of terror… But great threats bring out the most noble of champions! Mighty paladins heed the call for heroes—But can their martial prowess and holy might turn back the Darkness?

The Rise of the Undead Dragon Expansion is a brand new adventure for Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness featuring a new boss, new monsters, and new heroes ready to face them!

Age of Darkness is a fully-cooperative strategy board game of tactical combat and dungeon-crawl style adventure for one to five players. Explore the world of Drunagor through the game’s immersive 3d environment and illustrated Points of Interest—where your choices determine the route your story will take! You need a copy of the Chronicles of Drunagor: Age of Darkness core game to play with this expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board
publishers: Creative Games Studio LLC, Frosted Games, Pegasus Spiele

description:
Additional Townsfolk Card released during the spielbox (english Edition) Kickstarter.

Ability: choose one of those

1) Shuffle your discards back into your Draw Pile. Players must have at least 1 card in their discard pile to resolve this

2) Discard 2 cards from either your hand or Draw Pile. If you have no Draw Pile, you may shuffle your discards to discard from it

description:
Death Test 2 was MicroQuest #2 in the Metagaming MicroQuests series, programmed adventures for Melee and Wizard.

Sequel to Death Test, this paragraph-based adventure for the Melee/Wizard fantasy combat system recreates its predecessor's dungeon-crawl scenario but is significantly more difficult.


Steve Jackson reacquired the rights to TFT and published a new version of Death Test 2. More information can be found here...

A Zokmere Polearm weapon card for Sleeping Gods. This weapon card can be equipped to a crew member. It has +3 accuracy, deals 3 damage (and can deal +1 additional damage if you discard 1 equipped savvy card), and provides 1 block (2 if you miss).

Available as part of the Man vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter.

description: CW-M10 was available during the Cthulhu Wars Onslaught Two Kickstarter campaign. It includes the 6-8 player versions of the Earth map (CW-M4), Primeval map (CW-M6), Dreamlands map (CW-M7), Yuggoth map (CW-M8), and Library at Celaeno map (CW-M9). A plain white thin-walled box holds the maps together.

name: Tsukuyumi: Full Moon Down – Sentinels Expansion
description:
It is their holy quest to save earth from the Oni. They are mystic warriors, arising from the Jade Kingdom, a realm in which all surviving otherworldly creatures found shelter, after humans began killing and hunting them. The Sentinels still protect the earth whenever Oni walk it. So they return through their jade portals. Possessed with the magic of ancient times, like the Kami had, they can hide in plain sight. Their jade armor hides them, when a mortal is looking at them.

As Oni appeared in several times during earth's history, the Sentinels adapted to these times. Although they are ancient warriors, some use modern technology while others stay traditional. But in the end, they are here to save the earth - but not the humans anymore. They walk between both worlds, the protectors of two realms.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Closed Drafting, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Eclipse: Second Dawn for the Galaxy – Outcasts
description:
This upcoming expansion will introduce two new species to play your Eclipse - 2nd Dawn for the Galaxy with,
The Exiles and The Rho Indi Syndicate.
categories: Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Catapult Feud: Vikings! Expansion
description:
Build your castles, set up your troops, load your catapults and use your cunning tactics to win the day!

The War for the Floor has begun once more!

Catapult Feud: Vikings! Expansion introduces a new game mode. During setup, place the Viking Longship in the battlefield at an equal distance between players. Shuffle the Viking cards and place them in a pile face down beside the Longship. Take 2 Viking warriors per player, place them in pairs at an equal distance between players. Each pair should face a different castle.

Beware! At the beginning of every round, the Viking warriors move forward, closer to the castles!

During the Tactics Phase, instead of playing an Action card from your hand, you may reveal and resolve the top card from the Viking pile.

This expansion requires Catapult Feud to play.

Warning! This is a game of construction/destruction of plastic bricks and figures... NOT your opponent, pets, or people who may foolishly pass through the field of battle! Please play fair and be careful not to hurt each other or damage anything... other than your opponent's attempt at an impenetrable fortress!

Note: This expansion was originally marketed as Catapult Kingdoms: Vikings Expansion.

-description from publisher

Includes:
- 8 x Miniatures
- 1 x Viking Longship
- 8 x Boulder Ammo
- 12 x Action Cards
- 1 x Rule Book
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Events, Movement Template

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Ogre
description:
From Games Workshop webstore:
"Able to smash, crash and bash through even the toughest opponents, Ogres provide Human teams with that touch of utter brutality sometimes missing from their rosters. It’s not that the Humans they play alongside are puny, far from it – it’s just that sometimes a wall of linemen needs to be shattered, and an Ogre can get the job done much more quickly, and with much nastier results. It’s just more efficient!

This multi-part plastic kit contains the components necessary to assemble a Blood Bowl Ogre. He comes supplied with a 32mm Blood Bowl round base, featuring a hole to slot the ball into when your miniature has possession."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tannhäuser: Matriarchy Troop Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Matriarchy Troop Pack for Tannhäuser further expands the Matriarchy faction by adding two stunningly painted miniatures – the fearless Boepripacy Soldat and the flamethrower-wielding Zazigag Soldat – along with game tokens, equipments cards, and a detailed 12-page rulebook with an all-new scenario.

This scenario pits a Nippon Accords force against an alliance of UMTOMA soldiers, as the Reich's Karl Zermann attempts to recover an ancient artifact for Von Heïzinger.

name: Warhammer (Fourth Edition): Battle Magic
description:
The Warhammer Battle Magic boxed set is an expansion for Warhammer: The Mass Combat Fantasy Roleplaying Game (1st Edition) (4th Edition)(1992).

It adds wizards, spells and magic items to the game. Special rules and unique spells are included for the eight colleges of magic plus High and Dark magic, Waaagh magic (Orcs & Goblins), Skaven magic and three Chaos god magics.

name: Mombasa (Limited Edition)
description:
The Holzbox edition was limited to 500 copies. It contained E1/E2 Company Track which was a mini-expansion that was exclusive to this limited edition and was never released by itself.

Company E1 allows investing players to interact with discarded card.
Company E2 allows investing players to permanently have diamond merchants and bonus mining icons for the company.


In Mombasa, players acquire shares of chartered companies based in Mombasa, Cape Town, Saint-Louis, and Cairo and propagate trading posts of these companies throughout the African continent in order to earn the most money.

Mombasa features a unique, rotating-display hand-mechanism that drives game play. Each round players choose action cards from their hand, then reveal them simultaneously and carry out the actions. These cards are then placed in a discard pile, and the previously played cards recovered for the subsequent round.

Each company has a double-sided company track, so games will vary quite a lot based on which tracks are revealed and at which companies they are placed.
categories: Economic

Some show their strength on the battlefield, like the Hound, Tyrion, or Lord Tywin. For others, like Maester Pycelle and the High Sparrow, their power is felt in the political arena. But make no mistake, they can influence the outcome of a battle all the same. name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – The Sewers & GCPD Maps Expansion
description:
This map-focused expansion for BATMAN™: GOTHAM CITY CHRONICLES offers a new double-sided game board representing two unique and iconic locations. Wage viscous battles amid the reeking waters of the Gotham City Sewers, and defend justice at the GCPD Police Headquarters.
In the accompanying booklet you will find 10 new missions for Versus mode for use with these new maps as well as the expansion boards found in Season 1 (Arkham Asylum, The Joker’s Funhouse and Wayne Manor).
Additionally, for when the Dark Knight needs a little extra power, this set includes a new double-tile for Batman’s Trasher Suit.

The Sewer
The sewers spawn a game board with a tight almost claustrophobic environment, obstructed lines of sight, a warren of walls and snug quarters full of villainy.
However, a section of the board is higher than the rest, which opens up lines of sight into many of these otherwise hidden zones, while providing the promontory bonus. But that aside, you are still going to have to sneak through the maze of abandoned quarters to look your opponent straight in the eye as you shoot.
These flophouses are excellent hiding spaces but achieving mission objectives will require you to hunt down evil in its’ lair, then melt away before the tide of approaching goons overwhelm you.
The board is separated into four large areas, the sluice clearly delineates 3 boundaries and the height difference between the zones adds another. Getting around the board requires a significant amount of movement, crossing the stinking sewers or jumping across takes a toll.
If you want to move about this board, better keep some cubes in reserve. Smooth area movement is a strategic requisite, hindering can shut your mobility down hard, so maintaining control of area boundaries is essential.
All this restriction is counterbalanced by highly mobile or parkour talented characters. They can easily navigate over the torrenting sluice and continue onwards, while highly mobile characters, like Killer Croc or King Shark can cross the board with ease as if the water wasn’t there allowing them access to an impressive amount of the board.
These characters are a valuable asset on this board, as the open up the possibility of sneaking behind enemy lines or quickly providing reinforcement to overrun areas, in other words, it’s Blitzkrieg time.

Police Headquarters
With this brand new game board we are presenting another important and exciting location in Gotham City. This building serves as a bastion of law and order and a shield against chaos. From this location, brave men and women organize and mobilize to ensure the innocent are protected and the wicked are brought to justice. Under the dedicated watch of Commissioner Gordon and his trusted officers, the GCPD prevails time and again against the looming threats of the criminal underworld.
The Police Station allows you to play through new adventures, such as protecting (or destroying) compromising evidence or ensuring the safe release of significant prisoners.
This board is organized into several sections, spanning several levels. On the ground floor, a long hallway allows characters to benefit from various lines of sight; but there are also intermittent columns which create advantageous cover.
Some areas, however, are more confined. These are ideal for the placement of objectives, such as cells, interrogation rooms, and the medical examiner’s facility. These areas are more difficult to access and well protected, so players will need to carefully consider the best routes to securing scenario objectives.
Each level offers different gameplay opportunities. On the first level, there are chief inspectors. This office, completely surrounded by walls, offers a necessary refuge for when the police station is under siege. The second floor overlooks a large corridor offering many tempting lines of sight. The archives sector, however, is a more enclosed space, offering only limited lines of sight. Those who can breach walls will, of course, have the option to cross over into adjacent rooms. Finally, the statue and columns of the police station allow particularly agile characters to quickly and easily access different levels and to avoid opponents—should that be of strategic benefit.
Because of its difficult terrain and the hidden paths created by columns, this board favors mobile characters. Centralized areas can be very dangerous due to the various lines of sight, and those attempting to cross should do so with caution.

10 Versus missions
This new game boards pack comes with:

A booklet with 10 new missions for the Versus mode expansion which allows to play new skirmishes on these two new game boards and on those of the expansions:


•2 missions on the police station game board.
•2 missions on the sewers game board.
•2 missions on the Wayne Manor game board (Wayne Manor expansion)
•2 missions on the Arkham Asylum game board (Arkham Asylum expansion)
•2 missions on the Joker’s Funhouse game board (Arkham Asylum expansion)

8 new tokens that represent new types of objectives and allow to play with hidden objectives.
Since many of you requested, one of these new missions for the Versus mode is to be played with double tiles. This is why you will find in this pack the double tile of Batman Trasher Suit (from the Wayne Manor expansion) as well as its life points marker.
All the new Leader powers for all the new miniatures from season 2 (expansions, picking zone...). Those powers allow the new characters to be selected as Leaders when playing the Versus mode expansion.


—description from the publisher

name: Tiny Epic Defenders (Second Edition): Deluxe Edition
description:
This entry is for deluxe edition of Tiny Epic Defenders (Second Edition), which also includes Kickstarter Deluxe Promo Pack.


Aughmoore is in ruins. The evil could not be contained and its darkness has spread to every region of the world. Shattering villages and infecting all forms of life. There has never been a more dire need for Heroes. Everyone who remains must rise up, must unite, and must risk everything to preserve what little spirit remains.

Tiny Epic Defenders is a riveting small-box cooperative game and it's back with an all new edition featuring new art, new abilities, ITEMeeples and new rules making for more exciting gameplay than ever before!

What's new:

Revamped gameplay - Many rule changes, small and large, has taken place to re-balance and enrich the game, including new character powers, new powers for Outer Regions, and completely redesigned Epic Foes, along with many subtle changes to the setup and rules.
All new art - Completely redesigned to get in line with the current art direction of Tiny Epic line.
ITEMeeples - Items have been redesigned to be permanent additions and this is artistically represented with ITEMeeples, first introduced in Tiny Epic Quest.
